name: 马可福音
description: 最早的福音书，记录耶稣基督的行动和神迹，强调祂是神的儿子

verses.zh: 神的儿子，耶稣基督福音的起头。
verses.en: The beginning of the good news about Jesus the Messiah, the Son of God.

verses.zh: 正如先知以赛亚书上记着说：看哪，我要差遣我的使者在你前面，预备道路。
verses.en: It is written in Isaiah the prophet: 'I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way'—

verses.zh: 在旷野有人声喊着说：预备主的道，修直他的路！
verses.en: 'a voice of one calling in the wilderness, Prepare the way for the Lord, make straight paths for him.'

verses.zh: 照这话，施洗的约翰来了，在旷野传悔改的洗礼，使罪得赦。
verses.en: And so John the Baptist appeared in the wilderness, preaching a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins.

verses.zh: 犹太全地和耶路撒冷的人都出去到约翰那里，承认他们的罪，在约旦河里受他的洗。
verses.en: The whole Judean countryside and all the people of Jerusalem went out to him. Confessing their sins, they were baptized by him in the Jordan River.

verses.zh: 约翰穿骆驼毛的衣服，腰束皮带，吃的是蝗虫、野蜜。
verses.en: John wore clothing made of camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.

verses.zh: 他传道说：有一位在我以后来的，能力比我更大，我就是弯腰给他解鞋带也是不配的。
verses.en: And this was his message: 'After me comes the one more powerful than I, the straps of whose sandals I am not worthy to stoop down and untie.

verses.zh: 我是用水给你们施洗，他却要用圣灵给你们施洗。
verses.en: I baptize you with water, but he will baptize you with the Holy Spirit.'

verses.zh: 那时，耶稣从加利利的拿撒勒来，在约旦河里受了约翰的洗。
verses.en: At that time Jesus came from Nazareth in Galilee and was baptized by John in the Jordan.

verses.zh: 他从水里一上来，就看见天裂开了，圣灵仿佛鸽子，降在他身上。
verses.en: Just as Jesus was coming up out of the water, he saw heaven being torn open and the Spirit descending on him like a dove.

verses.zh: 又有声音从天上来，说：你是我的爱子，我喜悦你。
verses.en: And a voice came from heaven: 'You are my Son, whom I love; with you I am well pleased.'

verses.zh: 圣灵就把耶稣催到旷野里去。
verses.en: At once the Spirit sent him out into the wilderness,

verses.zh: 他在旷野四十天，受撒但的试探，并与野兽同在一处，且有天使来伺候他。
verses.en: and he was in the wilderness forty days, being tempted by Satan. He was with the wild animals, and angels attended him.

verses.zh: 约翰下监以后，耶稣来到加利利，宣传神的福音，
verses.en: After John was put in prison, Jesus went into Galilee, proclaiming the good news of God.

verses.zh: 说：日期满了，神的国近了！你们当悔改，信福音。
verses.en: 'The time has come,' he said. 'The kingdom of God has come near. Repent and believe the good news!'

verses.zh: 耶稣顺着加利利的海边走，看见西门和西门的兄弟安得烈在海里撒网；他们本是打鱼的。
verses.en: As Jesus walked beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw Simon and his brother Andrew casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：来跟从我！我要叫你们得人如得鱼一样。
verses.en: 'Come, follow me,' Jesus said, 'and I will send you out to fish for people.'

verses.zh: 他们就立刻舍了网，跟从了他。
verses.en: At once they left their nets and followed him.

verses.zh: 耶稣稍往前走，又见西庇太的儿子雅各和雅各的兄弟约翰在船上补网。
verses.en: When he had gone a little farther, he saw James son of Zebedee and his brother John in a boat, preparing their nets.

verses.zh: 耶稣随即招呼他们，他们就把父亲西庇太和雇工人留在船上，跟从耶稣去了。
verses.en: Without delay he called them, and they left their father Zebedee in the boat with the hired men and followed him.

verses.zh: 到了迦百农，耶稣就在安息日进了会堂教训人。
verses.en: They went to Capernaum, and when the Sabbath came, Jesus went into the synagogue and began to teach.

verses.zh: 众人很希奇他的教训；因为他教训他们，正像有权柄的人，不像文士。
verses.en: The people were amazed at his teaching, because he taught them as one who had authority, not as the teachers of the law.

verses.zh: 在会堂里，有一个人被污鬼附着。他喊叫说：
verses.en: Just then a man in their synagogue who was possessed by an impure spirit cried out,

verses.zh: 拿撒勒人耶稣，我们与你有什么相干？你来灭我们吗？我知道你是谁，乃是神的圣者。
verses.en: 'What do you want with us, Jesus of Nazareth? Have you come to destroy us? I know who you are—the Holy One of God!'

verses.zh: 耶稣责备他说：不要作声！从这人身上出来吧！
verses.en: 'Be quiet!' said Jesus sternly. 'Come out of him!'

verses.zh: 污鬼叫那人抽了一阵疯，大声喊叫，就出来了。
verses.en: The impure spirit shook the man violently and came out of him with a shriek.

verses.zh: 众人都惊讶，以致彼此对问说：这是什么事？是个新道理啊！他用权柄吩咐污鬼，连污鬼也听从了他。
verses.en: The people were all so amazed that they asked each other, 'What is this? A new teaching—and with authority! He even gives orders to impure spirits and they obey him.'

verses.zh: 耶稣的名声就传遍了加利利的四方。
verses.en: News about him spread quickly over the whole region of Galilee.

verses.zh: 他们一出会堂，就同着雅各、约翰，进了西门和安得烈的家。
verses.en: As soon as they left the synagogue, they went with James and John to the home of Simon and Andrew.

verses.zh: 西门的岳母正害热病躺着，就有人告诉耶稣。
verses.en: Simon's mother-in-law was in bed with a fever, and they immediately told Jesus about her.

verses.zh: 耶稣进前拉着她的手，扶她起来，热就退了，她就伺候他们。
verses.en: So he went to her, took her hand and helped her up. The fever left her and she began to wait on them.

verses.zh: 天晚日落的时候，有人带着一切害病的，和被鬼附的，来到耶稣跟前。
verses.en: That evening after sunset the people brought to Jesus all the sick and demon-possessed.

verses.zh: 合城的人都聚集在门前。
verses.en: The whole town gathered at the door,

verses.zh: 耶稣治好了许多害各样病的人，又赶出许多鬼，不许鬼说话，因为鬼认识他。
verses.en: and Jesus healed many who had various diseases. He also drove out many demons, but he would not let the demons speak because they knew who he was.

verses.zh: 次日早晨，天未亮的时候，耶稣起来，到旷野地方去，在那里祷告。
verses.en: Very early in the morning, while it was still dark, Jesus got up, left the house and went off to a solitary place, where he prayed.

verses.zh: 西门和同伴追了他去，
verses.en: Simon and his companions went to look for him,

verses.zh: 遇见了就对他说：众人都找你。
verses.en: and when they found him, they exclaimed: 'Everyone is looking for you!'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：我们可以往别处去，到邻近的乡村，我也好在那里传道，因为我是为这事出来的。
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'Let us go somewhere else—to the nearby villages—so I can preach there also. That is why I have come.'

verses.zh: 于是在加利利全地，进了会堂，传道，赶鬼。
verses.en: So he traveled throughout Galilee, preaching in their synagogues and driving out demons.

verses.zh: 有一个长大麻疯的来求耶稣，向他跪下，说：你若肯，必能叫我洁净了。
verses.en: A man with leprosy came to him and begged him on his knees, 'If you are willing, you can make me clean.'

verses.zh: 耶稣动了慈心，就伸手摸他，说：我肯，你洁净了吧！
verses.en: Jesus was indignant. He reached out his hand and touched the man. 'I am willing,' he said. 'Be clean!'

verses.zh: 大麻疯即时离开他，他就洁净了。
verses.en: Immediately the leprosy left him and he was cleansed.

verses.zh: 耶稣严严地嘱咐他，就打发他走，
verses.en: Jesus sent him away at once with a strong warning:

verses.zh: 对他说：你要谨慎，什么话都不可告诉人，只要去把身体给祭司察看，又因为你洁净了，献上摩西所吩咐的礼物，对众人作证据。
verses.en: 'See that you don't tell this to anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the sacrifices that Moses commanded for your cleansing, as a testimony to them.'

verses.zh: 那人出去，倒说许多的话，把这件事传扬开了，叫耶稣以后不得再明明地进城，只好在外边旷野地方。人从各处都就了他来。
verses.en: Instead he went out and began to talk freely, spreading the news. As a result, Jesus could no longer enter a town openly but stayed outside in lonely places. Yet the people still came to him from everywhere.

verses.zh: 过了些日子，耶稣又进了迦百农。人听见他在房子里，
verses.en: A few days later, when Jesus again entered Capernaum, the people heard that he had come home.

verses.zh: 就有许多人聚集，甚至连门前都没有空地；耶稣就对他们讲道。
verses.en: They gathered in such large numbers that there was no room left, not even outside the door, and he preached the word to them.

verses.zh: 有人带着一个瘫子来见耶稣，是用四个人抬来的；
verses.en: Some men came, bringing to him a paralyzed man, carried by four of them.

verses.zh: 因为人多，不得近前，就把耶稣所在的房子，拆了房顶，既拆通了，就把瘫子连所躺卧的褥子都缙下来。
verses.en: Since they could not get him to Jesus because of the crowd, they made an opening in the roof above Jesus by digging through it and then lowered the mat the man was lying on.

verses.zh: 耶稣见他们的信心，就对瘫子说：'小子，你的罪赦了。'
verses.en: When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralyzed man, 'Son, your sins are forgiven.'

verses.zh: 有几个文士坐在那里，心里议论，说：
verses.en: Now some teachers of the law were sitting there, thinking to themselves,

verses.zh: '这个人为什么这样说呢？他说僭妄的话了。除了神以外，谁能赦罪呢？'
verses.en: 'Why does this fellow talk like that? He's blaspheming! Who can forgive sins but God alone?'

verses.zh: 耶稣心中知道他们心里这样议论，就说：'你们心里为什么这样议论呢？
verses.en: Immediately Jesus knew in his spirit that this was what they were thinking in their hearts, and he said to them, 'Why are you thinking these things?

verses.zh: 或对瘫子说你的罪赦了，或说起来！拿你的褥子行走，哪一样容易呢？
verses.en: Which is easier: to say to this paralyzed man, Your sins are forgiven, or to say, Get up, take your mat and walk?

verses.zh: 但要叫你们知道，人子在地上有赦罪的权柄。'就对瘫子说：
verses.en: But I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.' So he said to the man,

verses.zh: '我吹咐你，起来！拿你的褥子回家去吧。'
verses.en: 'I tell you, get up, take your mat and go home.'

verses.zh: 那人就起来，立刻拿着褥子，当众人面前出去了，以致众人都惊奇，归荣耀与神，说：'我们从来没有见过这样的事！'
verses.en: He got up, took his mat and walked out in full view of them all. This amazed everyone and they praised God, saying, 'We have never seen anything like this!'

verses.zh: 耶稣又出到海边去，众人都就了他来，他便教训他们。
verses.en: Once again Jesus went out beside the lake. A large crowd came to him, and he began to teach them.

verses.zh: 耶稣经过的时候，看见亚弗太的儿子利未坐在税关上，就对他说：'你跟从我来！'他就起来，跟从了耶稣。
verses.en: As he walked along, he saw Levi son of Alphaeus sitting at the tax collector's booth. 'Follow me,' Jesus told him, and Levi got up and followed him.

verses.zh: 耶稣在利未家里坐席的时候，有好些税吏和罪人与耶稣并门徒一同坐席；因为这样的人多，他们也跟随耶稣。
verses.en: While Jesus was having dinner at Levi's house, many tax collectors and sinners were eating with him and his disciples, for there were many who followed him.

verses.zh: 法利赛人中的文士（有古卷：文士和法利赛人）看见耶稣和罪人并税吏一同吃饭，就对他门徒说：'他和税吏并罪人一同吃喝吗？'
verses.en: When the teachers of the law who were Pharisees saw him eating with the sinners and tax collectors, they asked his disciples: 'Why does he eat with tax collectors and sinners?'

verses.zh: 耶稣听见，就对他们说：康健的人用不着医生，有病的人才用得着；我来本不是召义人，乃是召罪人。
verses.en: On hearing this, Jesus said to them, It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick. I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners.

verses.zh: 当下，约翰的门徒和法利赛人禁食。他们来问耶稣说：'约翰的门徒和法利赛人的门徒禁食，你的门徒倒不禁食，这是为什么呢？'
verses.en: Now John's disciples and the Pharisees were fasting. Some people came and asked Jesus, 'How is it that John's disciples and the disciples of the Pharisees are fasting, but yours are not?'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'新郎和陈客同在的时候，陈客岂能禁食呢？新郎还同在，他们不能禁食。
verses.en: Jesus answered, 'How can the guests of the bridegroom fast while he is with them? They cannot, so long as they have him with them.

verses.zh: 但日子将到，新郎要离开他们，那日他们就要禁食了。
verses.en: But the time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them, and on that day they will fast.

verses.zh: 没有人把新布缝在旧衣服上，恐怕所补上的新布带坏了旧衣服，破的就更大了。
verses.en: No one sews a patch of unshrunk cloth on an old garment. Otherwise, the new piece will pull away from the old, making the tear worse.

verses.zh: 也没有人把新酒装在旧皮袋里，恐怕酒把皮袋裂开，酒和皮袋就都坏了；惟把新酒装在新皮袋里。
verses.en: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. Otherwise, the wine will burst the skins, and both the wine and the wineskins will be ruined. No, they pour new wine into new wineskins.

verses.zh: 耶稣当安息日从麦地经过。他的门徒行走的时候，掂了麦穗。
verses.en: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields, and as his disciples walked along, they began to pick some heads of grain.

verses.zh: 法利赛人对耶稣说：'看哪，他们在安息日为什么做不可做的事呢？'
verses.en: The Pharisees said to him, 'Look, why are they doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath?'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'经上记着大卫和跟随他的人缺乏食物、饥饿之时所做的事，你们没有念过吗？
verses.en: He answered, 'Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry and in need?

verses.zh: 他当亚比亚他做大祭司的时候，怎么进了神的殿，吃了陈设饼，又给跟随他的人吃。这饼除了祭司以外，人都不可吃。'
verses.en: In the days of Abiathar the high priest, he entered the house of God and ate the consecrated bread, which is lawful only for priests to eat. And he also gave some to his companions.'

verses.zh: 又对他们说：'安息日是为人设立的，人不是为安息日设立的。
verses.en: Then he said to them, 'The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

verses.zh: 所以，人子也是安息日的主。'
verses.en: So the Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又进了会堂，在那里有一个人手枯干了。
verses.en: Another time Jesus went into the synagogue, and a man with a shriveled hand was there.

verses.zh: 众人窥探耶稣，在安息日医治不医治，意思要告他。
verses.en: Some of them were looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, so they watched him closely to see if he would heal him on the Sabbath.

verses.zh: 耶稣对那手枯干的人说：'起来，站在当中。'
verses.en: Jesus said to the man with the shriveled hand, 'Stand up in front of everyone.'

verses.zh: 又问众人说：'在安息日行善行恶，救命害命，哪样是可的呢？'他们都不作声。
verses.en: Then Jesus asked them, 'Which is lawful on the Sabbath: to do good or to do evil, to save life or to kill?' But they remained silent.

verses.zh: 耶稣怒目周围看他们，忧愁他们的心刚硬，就对那人说：'伸出手来！'他把手一伸，手就复了原。
verses.en: He looked around at them in anger and, deeply distressed at their stubborn hearts, said to the man, 'Stretch out your hand.' He stretched it out, and his hand was completely restored.

verses.zh: 法利赛人出去，同希律党的人商议怎样可以除灭耶稣。
verses.en: Then the Pharisees went out and began to plot with the Herodians how they might kill Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣和门徒退到海边去，有许多人从加利利跟随他。
verses.en: Jesus withdrew with his disciples to the lake, and a large crowd from Galilee followed.

verses.zh: 还有许多人听见他所做的大事，就从犹太、耶路撒冷、以土珥、约但河外，并推罗、西顿的四方来就他。
verses.en: When they heard about all he was doing, many people came to him from Judea, Jerusalem, Idumea, and the regions across the Jordan and around Tyre and Sidon.

verses.zh: 他因为人多，就咉咐门徒叫一只小船等候着，免得众人拥挤他。
verses.en: Because of the crowd he told his disciples to have a small boat ready for him, to keep the people from crowding against him.

verses.zh: 他治好了许多人，所以凡有灾病的，都挤进来要摸他。
verses.en: For he had healed many, so that those with diseases were pushing forward to touch him.

verses.zh: 污鬼无论何时看见他，就俯伏在他面前，喊着说：'你是神的儿子。'
verses.en: Whenever the impure spirits saw him, they fell down before him and cried out, 'You are the Son of God.'

verses.zh: 耶稣再三地嘩咐他们，不要把他显露出来。
verses.en: But he gave them strict orders not to tell others about him.

verses.zh: 耶稣上了山，随自己的意思叫人来；他们便来到他那里。
verses.en: Jesus went up on a mountainside and called to him those he wanted, and they came to him.

verses.zh: 他就设立十二个人，要他们常和自己同在（有古卷在此有：他就设立十二个人，又称他们为使徒），也要差他们去传道，
verses.en: He appointed twelve that they might be with him and that he might send them out to preach

verses.zh: 并给他们权柄赶鬼。
verses.en: and to have authority to drive out demons.

verses.zh: 这十二个人有西门（耶稣又给他起名叫彼得），
verses.en: These are the twelve he appointed: Simon (to whom he gave the name Peter),

verses.zh: 还有西庇太的儿子雅各和雅各的兄弟约翰（这两个人耶稣又给他们起名叫半尼歌，就是雷子的意思），
verses.en: James son of Zebedee and his brother John (to them he gave the name Boanerges, which means 'sons of thunder'),

verses.zh: 又有安得烈、腹力、巴多罗买、马太、多马、亚弗太的儿子雅各、和奋锐党的西门。
verses.en: Andrew, Philip, Bartholomew, Matthew, Thomas, James son of Alphaeus, Thaddaeus, Simon the Zealot

verses.zh: 还有卖耶稣的加略人犹大。
verses.en: and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.

verses.zh: 耶稣进了一个屋子，众人又聚集，甚至他连饭也顾不得吃。
verses.en: Then Jesus entered a house, and again a crowd gathered, so that he and his disciples were not even able to eat.

verses.zh: 耶稣的亲属听见就出来要拉住他，因为他们说他疙狂了。
verses.en: When his family heard about this, they went to take charge of him, for they said, 'He is out of his mind.'

verses.zh: 从耶路撒冷下来的文士说：'他是被别西卜附着；'又说：'他是靠着鬼王赶鬼。'
verses.en: And the teachers of the law who came down from Jerusalem said, 'He is possessed by Beelzebul! By the prince of demons he is driving out demons.'

verses.zh: 耶稣叫他们来，用比喻对他们说：'撒但怎能赶出撒但呢？
verses.en: So Jesus called them over to him and began to speak to them in parables: 'How can Satan drive out Satan?

verses.zh: 若一国自相分争，那国就站立不住；
verses.en: If a kingdom is divided against itself, that kingdom cannot stand.

verses.zh: 若一家自相分争，那家就站立不住。
verses.en: If a house is divided against itself, that house cannot stand.

verses.zh: 若撒但自相攻打分争，他就站立不住，必要灭亡。
verses.en: And if Satan opposes himself and is divided, he cannot stand; his end has come.

verses.zh: 没有人能进壮士家里，抢夺他的家具；必先捆住那壮士，才可以抢夺他的家。
verses.en: In fact, no one can enter a strong man's house without first tying him up. Then he can plunder the strong man's house.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，世人一切的罪和一切诵渎的话都可以得到赦免；
verses.en: Truly I tell you, people can be forgiven all their sins and every slander they utter,

verses.zh: 凡诵渎圣灵的，却永不得赦免，乃要担当永远的罪。
verses.en: but whoever blasphemes against the Holy Spirit will never be forgiven; they are guilty of an eternal sin.

verses.zh: 这话是因为他们说：'他是被污鬼附着的。'
verses.en: He said this because they were saying, 'He has an impure spirit.'

verses.zh: 当下，耶稣的母亲和弟兄来，站在外边，打发人去叫他。
verses.en: Then Jesus' mother and brothers arrived. Standing outside, they sent someone in to call him.

verses.zh: 有许多人在耶稣周围坐着，他们就告诉他说：'看哪，你母亲和你弟兄在外边找你。'
verses.en: A crowd was sitting around him, and they told him, 'Your mother and brothers are outside looking for you.'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'谁是我的母亲？谁是我的弟兄？'
verses.en: 'Who are my mother and my brothers?' he asked.

verses.zh: 就四面观看那周围坐着的人，说：'看哪，我的母亲，我的弟兄！
verses.en: Then he looked at those seated in a circle around him and said, 'Here are my mother and my brothers!

verses.zh: 凡遵行神旨意的人，就是我的弟兄姐妹和母亲了。
verses.en: Whoever does God's will is my brother and sister and mother.

verses.zh: 耶稣又在海边教训人。有许多人到他那里聚集，他只得上船坐下。船在海里，众人都靠近海，站在岸上。
verses.en: Again Jesus began to teach by the lake. The crowd that gathered around him was so large that he got into a boat and sat in it out on the lake, while all the people were along the shore at the water's edge.

verses.zh: 耶稣就用比喻教训他们许多道理。在教训之间，对他们说：
verses.en: He taught them many things by parables, and in his teaching said:

verses.zh: '你们听啊！有一个撒种的出去撒种。
verses.en: 'Listen! A farmer went out to sow his seed.

verses.zh: 撒的时候，有落在路旁的，飞鸟来吃尽了；
verses.en: As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.

verses.zh: 有落在土浅石头地上的，土既不厚，发苗甚早，
verses.en: Some fell on rocky places, where it did not have much soil. It sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.

verses.zh: 日头出来一晒，因为没有根，就枯干了；
verses.en: But when the sun came up, the plants were scorched, and they withered because they had no root.

verses.zh: 有落在荆棘里的，荆棘长起来，把它挤住了，就不结实；
verses.en: Other seed fell among thorns, which grew up and choked the plants, so that they did not bear grain.

verses.zh: 又有落在好土里的，就发生长大，结实有三十倍的，有六十倍的，有一百倍的；'
verses.en: Still other seed fell on good soil. It came up, grew and produced a crop, some multiplying thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times.'

verses.zh: 又说：'有耳可听的，就应当听！'
verses.en: Then Jesus said, 'Whoever has ears to hear, let them hear.'

verses.zh: 无人的时候，跟随耶稣的人和十二个门徒问他这比喻的意思。
verses.en: When he was alone, the Twelve and the others around him asked him about the parables.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'神国的奥秘只叫你们知道，若是对外人讲，凡事就用比喻，
verses.en: He told them, 'The secret of the kingdom of God has been given to you. But to those on the outside everything is said in parables

verses.zh: 叫他们看是看见，却不晓得；听是听见，却不明白；恐怕他们回转过来，就得赦免。'
verses.en: so that, they may be ever seeing but never perceiving, and ever hearing but never understanding; otherwise they might turn and be forgiven!'

verses.zh: 又对他们说：'你们不明白这比喻吗？这样怎能明白一切的比喻呢？
verses.en: Then Jesus said to them, 'Don't you understand this parable? How then will you understand any parable?

verses.zh: 撒种之人所撒的就是道。
verses.en: The farmer sows the word.

verses.zh: 那撒在路旁的，就是人听了道，撒但立刻来，把撒在他心里的道夺了去。
verses.en: Some people are like seed along the path, where the word is sown. As soon as they hear it, Satan comes and takes away the word that was sown in them.

verses.zh: 那撒在石头地上的，就是人听了道，立刻欢喜领受，
verses.en: Others, like seed sown on rocky places, hear the word and at once receive it with joy.

verses.zh: 但他心里没有根，不过是暂时的，及至为道遇了患难，或是受了逼迫，立刻就跌倒了。
verses.en: But since they have no root, they last only a short time. When trouble or persecution comes because of the word, they quickly fall away.

verses.zh: 还有那撒在荆棘里的，就是人听了道，
verses.en: Still others, like seed sown among thorns, hear the word;

verses.zh: 后来有世上的思虑、钱财的迷惑，和别样的私欲进来，把道挤住了，就不能结实。
verses.en: but the worries of this life, the deceitfulness of wealth and the desires for other things come in and choke the word, making it unfruitful.

verses.zh: 那撒在好土上的，就是人听道，又领受，并且结实，有三十倍的，有六十倍的，有一百倍的。'
verses.en: Others, like seed sown on good soil, hear the word, accept it, and produce a crop—some thirty, some sixty, some a hundred times what was sown.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又对他们说：'人拿灯来，岂是要放在斗底下，床底下，不放在灯台上吗？
verses.en: He said to them, 'Do you bring in a lamp to put it under a bowl or a bed? Instead, don't you put it on its stand?

verses.zh: 因为没有隐藏的事不被显出来，也没有隐瞒的事不被表明出来。
verses.en: For whatever is hidden is meant to be disclosed, and whatever is concealed is meant to be brought out into the open.

verses.zh: 有耳可听的，就应当听！'
verses.en: If anyone has ears to hear, let them hear.'

verses.zh: 又说：'你们所听的要留心。你们用什么量器量给人，也必用什么量器量给你们，并且要多给你们。
verses.en: 'Consider carefully what you hear,' he continued. 'With the measure you use, it will be measured to you—and even more.

verses.zh: 因为有的，还要给他；没有的，连他所有的也要夺去。'
verses.en: Whoever has will be given more; whoever does not have, even what they have will be taken from them.'

verses.zh: 又说：'神的国如同人把种撒在地上。
verses.en: He also said, 'This is what the kingdom of God is like. A man scatters seed on the ground.

verses.zh: 黑夜睡觉，白日起来，这种就发芽渐长，那人却不晓得如何这样。
verses.en: Night and day, whether he sleeps or gets up, the seed sprouts and grows, though he does not know how.

verses.zh: 地生五谷是出于自然的，先发苗，后长穗，再后穗上结成饶满的子粒（原文作子粒）。
verses.en: All by itself the soil produces grain—first the stalk, then the head, then the full kernel in the head.

verses.zh: 谷熟了，就用镰刀去割，因为收成的时候到了。'
verses.en: As soon as the grain is ripe, he puts the sickle to it, because the harvest has come.'

verses.zh: 又说：'神的国，我们可用什么来比较呢？可用什么比喻来表明呢？
verses.en: Again he said, 'What shall we say the kingdom of God is like, or what parable shall we use to describe it?

verses.zh: 好像一粒芝麻，种在地里的时候，虽比地上的百种都小，
verses.en: It is like a mustard seed, which is the smallest of all seeds on earth.

verses.zh: 但种上以后，就长起来，比各样的菜都大，又长出大枝来，甚至天上的飞鸟可以宿在它的荫下。'
verses.en: Yet when planted, it grows and becomes the largest of all garden plants, with such big branches that the birds can perch in its shade.'

verses.zh: 耶稣用许多这样的比喻，照他们所能听的，对他们讲道。
verses.en: With many similar parables Jesus spoke the word to them, as much as they could understand.

verses.zh: 若不用比喻，就不对他们讲；没有人的时候，就把一切的道都给门徒解明。
verses.en: He did not say anything to them without using a parable. But when he was alone with his own disciples, he explained everything.

verses.zh: 当那天晚上，耶稣对门徒说：'我们渡到那边去吧。'
verses.en: That day when evening came, he said to his disciples, 'Let us go over to the other side.'

verses.zh: 门徒离开众人，耶稣仍在船上，他们就把他一同带去；也有别的船和他同行。
verses.en: Leaving the crowd behind, they took him along, just as he was, in the boat. There were also other boats with him.

verses.zh: 忽然起了暗风，波浪打入船内，甚至船要满了水。
verses.en: A furious squall came up, and the waves broke over the boat, so that it was nearly swamped.

verses.zh: 耶稣在船尾上，枕着枕头睡觉。门徒叫醒了他，说：'夫子！我们丧命，你不理吗？'
verses.en: Jesus was in the stern, sleeping on a cushion. The disciples woke him and said to him, 'Teacher, don't you care if we drown?'

verses.zh: 耶稣醒了，斥责风，向海说：'住了吧！静了吧！'风就止住，大大地平静了。
verses.en: He got up, rebuked the wind and said to the waves, 'Quiet! Be still!' Then the wind died down and it was completely calm.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'为什么胆怖？你们还没有信心吗？'
verses.en: He said to his disciples, 'Why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith?'

verses.zh: 他们就大大地惧怕，彼此说：这到底是谁，连风和海也听从他了？
verses.en: They were terrified and asked each other, Who is this? Even the wind and the waves obey him!

verses.zh: 他们来到海那边格拉森人的地方。
verses.en: They went across the lake to the region of the Gerasenes.

verses.zh: 耶稣一下船，就有一个被污鬼附着的人从坟地迎面而来。
verses.en: When Jesus got out of the boat, a man with an impure spirit came from the tombs to meet him.

verses.zh: 那人常住在坟地里，没有人能捆住他，就是用铁链也不能；
verses.en: This man lived in the tombs, and no one could bind him anymore, not even with a chain.

verses.zh: 因为人屠次用脚镫和铁链捆锁他，铁链站被他挥断了，脚镫也被他弄碎了；总没有人能制伏他。
verses.en: For he had often been chained hand and foot, but he tore the chains apart and broke the irons on his feet. No one was strong enough to subdue him.

verses.zh: 他昆夜常在坟地里和山中喊叫，又用石头砍自己。
verses.en: Night and day among the tombs and in the hills he would cry out and cut himself with stones.

verses.zh: 他远远地看见耶稣，就跑过去拜他，
verses.en: When he saw Jesus from a distance, he ran and fell on his knees in front of him.

verses.zh: 大声喊叫说：'至高神的儿子耶稣，我与你有什么相干？我指着神恳求你，不要叫我受苦！'
verses.en: He shouted at the top of his voice, 'What do you want with me, Jesus, Son of the Most High God? In God's name don't torture me!'

verses.zh: 是因耶稣曾吹咐他说：'污鬼啊，从这人身上出来！'
verses.en: For Jesus had said to him, 'Come out of this man, you impure spirit!'

verses.zh: 耶稣问他说：'你名叫什么？'回答说：'我名叫群，因为我们多的缘故；'
verses.en: Then Jesus asked him, 'What is your name?' 'My name is Legion,' he replied, 'for we are many.'

verses.zh: 就再三地求耶稣，不要叫他们离开那地方。
verses.en: And he begged Jesus again and again not to send them out of the area.

verses.zh: 在那里山坡上，有一大群猪吃食；
verses.en: A large herd of pigs was feeding on the nearby hillside.

verses.zh: 鬼就央求耶稣说：'求你打发我们往猪群里，附着猪去。'
verses.en: The demons begged Jesus, 'Send us among the pigs; allow us to go into them.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就准了他们，污鬼就出来，进入猪里去。于是那群猪闯下山崖，投在海里，淆死了。猪的数目约有二千。
verses.en: He gave them permission, and the impure spirits came out and went into the pigs. The herd, about two thousand in number, rushed down the steep bank into the lake and were drowned.

verses.zh: 放猪的就逃跑了，去告诉城里和乡下的人。众人就来，要看是什么事。
verses.en: Those tending the pigs ran off and reported this in the town and countryside, and the people went out to see what had happened.

verses.zh: 他们来到耶稣那里，看见那被鬼附着的人，就是从前被群鬼所附的，坐着，穿上衣服，心里明白过来，他们就害怕。
verses.en: When they came to Jesus, they saw the man who had been possessed by the legion of demons, sitting there, dressed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

verses.zh: 看见这事的，便将鬼附之人所遇见的和那群猪的事都告诉了众人。
verses.en: Those who had seen it told the people what had happened to the demon-possessed man—and told about the pigs as well.

verses.zh: 众人就央求耶稣离开他们的境界。
verses.en: Then the people began to plead with Jesus to leave their region.

verses.zh: 耶稣上船的时候，那从前被鬼附着的人恳求和耶稣同在。
verses.en: As Jesus was getting into the boat, the man who had been demon-possessed begged to go with him.

verses.zh: 耶稣不许，却对他说：'你回家去，到你的亲属那里，将主为你所做的是何等大事，是怎样怜悯你，都告诉他们。'
verses.en: Jesus did not let him, but said, 'Go home to your own people and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.'

verses.zh: 那人就走了，在低加波利传扬耶稣为他做了何等大事，众人就都希奇。
verses.en: So the man went away and began to tell in the Decapolis how much Jesus had done for him. And all the people were amazed.

verses.zh: 耶稣坐船又渡到那边去，就有许多人到他那里聚集；耶稣正在海边上。
verses.en: When Jesus had again crossed over by boat to the other side of the lake, a large crowd gathered around him while he was by the lake.

verses.zh: 有一个管会堂的人，名叫睚鲁，来见耶稣，就俯伏在他脚前，
verses.en: Then one of the synagogue leaders, named Jairus, came, and when he saw Jesus, he fell at his feet.

verses.zh: 再三地求他，说：'我的小女儿快要死了，求你去按手在她身上，使她痊愈，得以活着。'
verses.en: He pleaded earnestly with him, 'My little daughter is dying. Please come and put your hands on her so that she will be healed and live.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就和他同去。有许多人跟随拥挤他。
verses.en: So Jesus went with him. A large crowd followed and pressed around him.

verses.zh: 有一个女人，患了十二年的血漏，
verses.en: And a woman was there who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years.

verses.zh: 在好些医生手里受了许多的苦，又花尽了她所有的，一点也不见好，病势反倒更重了。
verses.en: She had suffered a great deal under the care of many doctors and had spent all she had, yet instead of getting better she grew worse.

verses.zh: 她听见耶稣的事，就从后头来杂在众人中间，摸耶稣的衣裳，
verses.en: When she heard about Jesus, she came up behind him in the crowd and touched his cloak,

verses.zh: 意思说：'我只摸他的衣裳，就必痊愈。'
verses.en: because she thought, 'If I just touch his clothes, I will be healed.'

verses.zh: 于是她血漏的源头立刻干了，她便觉得身上的灾病好了。
verses.en: Immediately her bleeding stopped and she felt in her body that she was freed from her suffering.

verses.zh: 耶稣顿时心里觉得有能力从自己身上出去，就在众人中间转过身来，说：'谁摸我的衣裳？'
verses.en: At once Jesus realized that power had gone out from him. He turned around in the crowd and asked, 'Who touched my clothes?'

verses.zh: 门徒对他说：'你看众人拥挤你，还说谁摸我吗？'
verses.en: 'You see the people crowding against you,' his disciples answered, 'and yet you can ask, Who touched me?'

verses.zh: 耶稣周围观看，要见做这事的女人。
verses.en: But Jesus kept looking around to see who had done it.

verses.zh: 那女人知道在自己身上所成的事，就恐惧战章，来俯伏在耶稣跟前，将实情全告诉他。
verses.en: Then the woman, knowing what had happened to her, came and fell at his feet and, trembling with fear, told him the whole truth.

verses.zh: 耶稣对她说：'女儿，你的信救了你，平平安安地回去吧！你的灾病痊愈了。'
verses.en: He said to her, 'Daughter, your faith has healed you. Go in peace and be freed from your suffering.'

verses.zh: 还说话的时候，有人从管会堂的家里来，说：'你的女儿死了，何必还劳动先生呢？'
verses.en: While Jesus was still speaking, some people came from the house of Jairus, the synagogue leader. 'Your daughter is dead,' they said. 'Why bother the teacher anymore?'

verses.zh: 耶稣听见所说的话，就对管会堂的说：不要怕！只要信！
verses.en: Overhearing what they said, Jesus told him, Don't be afraid; just believe.

verses.zh: 于是带着彼得、雅各，和雅各的兄弟约翰同去，不许别人跟随他。
verses.en: He did not let anyone follow him except Peter, James and John the brother of James.

verses.zh: 他们来到管会堂的家里；耶稣看见那里乱喧喧，并有人大大地哭泣哀号。
verses.en: When they came to the home of the synagogue leader, Jesus saw a commotion, with people crying and wailing loudly.

verses.zh: 进到里面，就对他们说：'为什么乱喧喧的哭泣呢？孩子不是死了，是睡着了。'
verses.en: He went in and said to them, 'Why all this commotion and wailing? The child is not dead but asleep.'

verses.zh: 他们就嘘笑耶稣。耶稣把他们都赶出去，就带着孩子的父母，和跟随的人进了孩子所在的地方，
verses.en: But they laughed at him. After he put them all out, he took the child's father and mother and the disciples who were with him, and went in where the child was.

verses.zh: 就拉着孩子的手，对她说：'大利大古米！'（翻出来就是说：'闺女，我吹咐你起来！'）
verses.en: He took her by the hand and said to her, 'Talitha koum!' (which means 'Little girl, I say to you, get up!').

verses.zh: 那闺女立时起来走。原来她是十二岁。他们就大大地惊奇。
verses.en: Immediately the girl stood up and began to walk around (she was twelve years old). At this they were completely astonished.

verses.zh: 耶稣切切地嘩咐他们，不要叫人知道这事，又吉咐给她东西吃。
verses.en: He gave strict orders not to let anyone know about this, and told them to give her something to eat.

verses.zh: 耶稣离开那里，来到自己的家乡；门徒也跟从他。
verses.en: Jesus left there and went to his hometown, accompanied by his disciples.

verses.zh: 到了安息日，他在会堂里教训人。许多人听见，就甚希奇，说：'这人从哪里有这些事呢？所赐给他的是什么智慧？他手里怎么有这样的异能呢？
verses.en: When the Sabbath came, he began to teach in the synagogue, and many who heard him were amazed. 'Where did this man get these things?' they asked. 'What's this wisdom that has been given him? What are these remarkable miracles he is performing?

verses.zh: 这不是那木匠吗？不是马利亚的儿子雅各、约西、犹大、西门的长兄吗？他妓妓们不也是在我们这里吗？'他们就厌弃他（厌弃他：原文作因他跌倒）。
verses.en: Isn't this the carpenter? Isn't this Mary's son and the brother of James, Joseph, Judas and Simon? Aren't his sisters here with us?' And they took offense at him.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'大凡先知，除了本地、亲属、本家之外，没有不被人尊敬的。'
verses.en: Jesus said to them, 'A prophet is not without honor except in his own town, among his relatives and in his own home.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就在那里不得行什么异能，不过按手在几个病人身上，治好了他们。
verses.en: He could not do any miracles there, except lay his hands on a few sick people and heal them.

verses.zh: 他也誝怪他们不信，就往周围乡村教训人去了。
verses.en: He was amazed at their lack of faith. Then Jesus went around teaching from village to village.

verses.zh: 耶稣叫了十二个门徒来，差遣他们两个两个地出去，也赐给他们权柄，制伏污鬼；
verses.en: Calling the Twelve to him, he began to send them out two by two and gave them authority over impure spirits.

verses.zh: 并且嚉咐他们：'行路的时候不要带食物和口袋，腰袋里也不要带钱，除了拐杖以外，什么都不要带；
verses.en: These were his instructions: 'Take nothing for the journey except a staff—no bread, no bag, no money in your belts.

verses.zh: 只穿鞋，也不要穿两件袄子；'
verses.en: Wear sandals but not an extra shirt.

verses.zh: 又对他们说：'你们无论到何处，进了人的家，就在那里住，直到离开那地方。
verses.en: Whenever you enter a house, stay there until you leave that town.

verses.zh: 何处的人不接待你们，不听你们，你们离开那里的时候，就把脚下的尘土跑掉，对他们作见证。'
verses.en: And if any place will not welcome you or listen to you, leave that place and shake the dust off your feet as a testimony against them.'

verses.zh: 门徒就出去传道，叫人惔改，
verses.en: They went out and preached that people should repent.

verses.zh: 又赶出许多的鬼，用油抹了许多病人，治好了他们。
verses.en: They drove out many demons and anointed many sick people with oil and healed them.

verses.zh: 耶稣的名声传扬出来。希律王听见了，就说：'施洗的约翰从死里复活了，所以这些异能发现在他身上。'
verses.en: King Herod heard about this, for Jesus' name had become well known. Some were saying, 'John the Baptist has been raised from the dead, and that is why miraculous powers are at work in him.'

verses.zh: 但别人说：'是以利亚。'又有人说：'是先知，正像先知中的一位。'
verses.en: Others said, 'He is Elijah.' And still others claimed, 'He is a prophet, like one of the prophets of long ago.'

verses.zh: 但希律听见却说：'是我所斩的约翰，他复活了。'
verses.en: But when Herod heard this, he said, 'John, whom I beheaded, has been raised from the dead!'

verses.zh: 先是希律为他兄弟腹力的妻子希罗底的缘故，差人去拿住约翰，锁在监里，因为希律已经娶了那妇人。
verses.en: For Herod himself had given orders to have John arrested, and he had him bound and put in prison. He did this because of Herodias, his brother Philip's wife, whom he had married.

verses.zh: 约翰曾对希律说：'你娶你兄弟的妻子是不可的。'
verses.en: For John had been saying to Herod, 'It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.'

verses.zh: 于是希罗底怀恨他，想要杀他，只是不能；
verses.en: So Herodias nursed a grudge against John and wanted to kill him. But she was not able to,

verses.zh: 因为希律知道约翰是义人，是圣人，所以敬畏他，保护他，听他讲论，就多照着行，并且乐意听他。
verses.en: because Herod feared John and protected him, knowing him to be a righteous and holy man. When Herod heard John, he was greatly puzzled; yet he liked to listen to him.

verses.zh: 有一天，恋机来了。希律在他的生日为他的大臣和千夫长，并加利利的首领设摆筵席，
verses.en: Finally the opportune time came. On his birthday Herod gave a banquet for his high officials and military commanders and the leading men of Galilee.

verses.zh: 希罗底的女儿进来跳舞，使希律和同席的人都欢喜。王就对女子说：'你随意向我求什么，我必给你；'
verses.en: When the daughter of Herodias came in and danced, she pleased Herod and his dinner guests. The king said to the girl, 'Ask me for anything you want, and I'll give it to you.'

verses.zh: 又对她起誓说：'随你向我求什么，就是我国的一半，我也必给你。'
verses.en: And he promised her with an oath, 'Whatever you ask I will give you, up to half my kingdom.'

verses.zh: 她就出去对她母亲说：'我可以求什么呢？'她母亲说：'施洗约翰的头。'
verses.en: She went out and said to her mother, 'What shall I ask for?' 'The head of John the Baptist,' she answered.

verses.zh: 她就急忙进去见王，求他说：'我愿王立时把施洗约翰的头放在盘子里给我。'
verses.en: At once the girl hurried in to the king with the request: 'I want you to give me right now the head of John the Baptist on a platter.'

verses.zh: 王就甚忧愁；但因他所起的誓，又因同席的人，就不能不应她。
verses.en: The king was greatly distressed, but because of his oaths and his dinner guests, he did not want to refuse her.

verses.zh: 随即差一个卫兵，嚉咐拿约翰的头来。卫兵就去，在监里斩了约翰，
verses.en: So he immediately sent an executioner with orders to bring John's head. The man went, beheaded John in the prison,

verses.zh: 把头放在盘子里，拿来给女子，女子就给她母亲。
verses.en: and brought back his head on a platter. He presented it to the girl, and she gave it to her mother.

verses.zh: 约翰的门徒听见了，就来把他的尸首领去，葬在坟里。
verses.en: On hearing of this, John's disciples came and took his body and laid it in a tomb.

verses.zh: 使徒聚集到耶稣那里，将一切所做的事、所传的道全告诉他。
verses.en: The apostles gathered around Jesus and reported to him all they had done and taught.

verses.zh: 他就对他们说：你们来同我暗暗地到旷野地方去歇一歇。这是因为来往的人多，他们连吃饭也没有工夫。
verses.en: Then, because so many people were coming and going that they did not even have a chance to eat, he said to them, Come with me by yourselves to a quiet place and get some rest.

verses.zh: 他们就坐船，暗暗地往旷野地方去。
verses.en: So they went away by themselves in a boat to a solitary place.

verses.zh: 众人看见他们去，有许多人知道他们，就从各城步行，一同跑到那里，比他们先到了。
verses.en: But many who saw them leaving recognized them and ran on foot from all the towns and got there ahead of them.

verses.zh: 耶稣出来，见有许多的人，就怜悯他们，因为他们如同羊没有牧人一般，于是开口教训他们许多道理。
verses.en: When Jesus landed and saw a large crowd, he had compassion on them, because they were like sheep without a shepherd. So he began teaching them many things.

verses.zh: 天已经晚了，门徒进前来，说：'这是野地，天已经晚了，
verses.en: By this time it was late in the day, so his disciples came to him. 'This is a remote place,' they said, 'and it's already very late.

verses.zh: 请叫众人散开，他们好往四面乡村里去，自己买什么吃的。'
verses.en: Send the people away so that they can go to the surrounding countryside and villages and buy themselves something to eat.'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'你们给他们吃吧！'门徒说：'我们可以去买二十两银子的饼给他们吃吗？'
verses.en: But he answered, 'You give them something to eat.' They said to him, 'That would take more than half a year's wages! Are we to go and spend that much on bread and give it to them to eat?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们有多少饼，可以去看看。'他们知道了，就说：'五个饼，两条鱼。'
verses.en: 'How many loaves do you have?' he asked. 'Go and see.' When they found out, they said, 'Five—and two fish.'

verses.zh: 耶稣嘉咐他们，叫众人一帮一帮地坐在青草地上。
verses.en: Then Jesus directed them to have all the people sit down in groups on the green grass.

verses.zh: 众人就一排一排地坐下，有一百一帮的，有五十一帮的。
verses.en: So they sat down in groups of hundreds and fifties.

verses.zh: 耶稣拿着这五个饼、两条鱼，望着天祝谢，擘开饼，递给门徒，摆在众人面前；也把那两条鱼分给众人。
verses.en: Taking the five loaves and the two fish and looking up to heaven, he gave thanks and broke the loaves. Then he gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people. He also divided the two fish among them all.

verses.zh: 他们都吃，并且吃饱了。
verses.en: They all ate and were satisfied,

verses.zh: 门徒就把碎饼碎鱼收拾起来，装满了十二个篮子。
verses.en: and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces of bread and fish.

verses.zh: 吃饼的男人共有五千。
verses.en: The number of the men who had eaten was five thousand.

verses.zh: 耶稣随即催门徒上船，先渡到那边伯赛大去，等他叫众人散开。
verses.en: Immediately Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to Bethsaida, while he dismissed the crowd.

verses.zh: 他既辞别了他们，就往山上去祷告。
verses.en: After leaving them, he went up on a mountainside to pray.

verses.zh: 到了晚上，船在海中，耶稣独自在岸上；
verses.en: Later that night, the boat was in the middle of the lake, and he was alone on land.

verses.zh: 看见门徒因风不顺，摇橹甚苦。夜里约有四更天，就在海面上走，往他们那里去，意思要走过他们去。
verses.en: He saw the disciples straining at the oars, because the wind was against them. Shortly before dawn he went out to them, walking on the lake. He was about to pass by them,

verses.zh: 但门徒看见他在海面上走，以为是鬼怪，就喊叫起来；
verses.en: but when they saw him walking on the lake, they thought he was a ghost. They cried out,

verses.zh: 因为他们都看见了他，就惊慌。耶稣连忙对他们说：'你们放心！是我，不要怕！'
verses.en: because they all saw him and were terrified. Immediately he spoke to them and said, 'Take courage! It is I. Don't be afraid.'

verses.zh: 于是到他们那里，上了船，风就住了；他们心里十分惊奇。
verses.en: Then he climbed into the boat with them, and the wind died down. They were completely amazed,

verses.zh: 这是因为他们不明白那分饼的事，心里还是愚顽。
verses.en: for they had not understood about the loaves; their hearts were hardened.

verses.zh: 既渡过去，来到革尼撒勒地方就靠了岸。
verses.en: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret and anchored there.

verses.zh: 一下船，众人认得是耶稣，
verses.en: As soon as they got out of the boat, people recognized Jesus.

verses.zh: 就跑遍那一带地方，听见他在何处，便将有病的人用褥子抬到那里。
verses.en: They ran throughout that whole region and carried the sick on mats to wherever they heard he was.

verses.zh: 凡耶稣所到的地方，无论是村中、是城里、是乡间，他们都将病人放在街市上，求耶稣只容他们摸他的衣裳繅子；凡摸着的人就都好了。
verses.en: And wherever he went—into villages, towns or countryside—they placed the sick in the marketplaces. They begged him to let them touch even the edge of his cloak, and all who touched it were healed.

verses.zh: 有法利赛人和几个文士从耶路撒冷来，到耶稣那里聚集。
verses.en: The Pharisees and some of the teachers of the law who had come from Jerusalem gathered around Jesus

verses.zh: 他们曾看见他的门徒中有人用俗手，就是没有洗的手，吃饭。
verses.en: and saw some of his disciples eating food with hands that were defiled, that is, unwashed.

verses.zh: （原来法利赛人和犹太人都拘守古人的遗传，若不仔细洗手就不吃饭；
verses.en: (The Pharisees and all the Jews do not eat unless they give their hands a ceremonial washing, holding to the tradition of the elders.

verses.zh: 从市上来，若不洗浴也不吃饭；还有好些别的规矩，他们历代拘守，就是洗杯、罐、铜器等物。）
verses.en: When they come from the marketplace they do not eat unless they wash. And they observe many other traditions, such as the washing of cups, pitchers and kettles.)

verses.zh: 法利赛人和文士问他说：'你的门徒为什么不照古人的遗传，用俗手吃饭呢？'
verses.en: So the Pharisees and teachers of the law asked Jesus, 'Why don't your disciples live according to the tradition of the elders instead of eating their food with defiled hands?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'以赛亚指着你们假冒为善的人所说的预言是不错的。如经上说：这百姓用嘴唇尊敬我，心却远离我。
verses.en: He replied, 'Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you hypocrites; as it is written: These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.

verses.zh: 他们将人的吩咐当作道理教导人，所以拜我也是枉然。'
verses.en: They worship me in vain; their teachings are merely human rules.'

verses.zh: 你们是离弃神的诫命，拘守人的遗传。'
verses.en: You have let go of the commands of God and are holding on to human traditions.'

verses.zh: 又说：'你们诚然是废弃神的诫命，要守自己的遗传。
verses.en: And he continued, 'You have a fine way of setting aside the commands of God in order to observe your own traditions!

verses.zh: 摩西说：当孝敬父母；又说：咒骂父母的，必治死他。
verses.en: For Moses said, Honor your father and mother, and, Anyone who curses their father or mother is to be put to death.

verses.zh: 你们倒说：人若对父母说：我所当奉给你的，已经作了各耳板（各耳板就是供献的意思），
verses.en: But you say that if anyone declares that what might have been used to help their father or mother is Corban (that is, devoted to God)—

verses.zh: 以后你们就不容他再奉养父母。
verses.en: then you no longer let them do anything for their father or mother.

verses.zh: 这就是你们承接遗传，废了神的道。你们还做许多这样的事。'
verses.en: Thus you nullify the word of God by your tradition that you have handed down. And you do many things like that.'

verses.zh: 耶稣又叫众人来，对他们说：'你们都要听我的话，也要明白。
verses.en: Again Jesus called the crowd to him and said, 'Listen to me, everyone, and understand this.

verses.zh: 从外面进去的不能污秽人，惟有从里面出来的乃能污秽人。'
verses.en: Nothing outside a person can defile them by going into them. Rather, it is what comes out of a person that defiles them.'

verses.zh: 有耳可听的，就应当听！
verses.en: If anyone has ears to hear, let them hear.

verses.zh: 耶稣离开众人，进了屋子，门徒就问他这比喻的意思。
verses.en: After he had left the crowd and entered the house, his disciples asked him about this parable.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'你们也是这样不明白吗？岂不晓得凡从外面进入的，不能污秽人，
verses.en: 'Are you so dull?' he asked. 'Don't you see that nothing that enters a person from the outside can defile them?

verses.zh: 因为不是入他的心，乃是入他的肚腹，又落到茅厕里（这是说，各样的食物都是洁净的）。'
verses.en: For it doesn't go into their heart but into their stomach, and then out of the body.' (In saying this, Jesus declared all foods clean.)

verses.zh: 又说：'从人里面出来的，那才能污秽人；
verses.en: He went on: 'What comes out of a person is what defiles them.

verses.zh: 因为从里面，就是从人心里，发出恶念、苟合、
verses.en: For it is from within, out of a person's heart, that evil thoughts come—sexual immorality,

verses.zh: 偷盗、凶杀、奸淫、贪婪、邪恶、诡诈、淫荡、嫉妒、谤讟、骄傲、狂妄。
verses.en: theft, murder, adultery, greed, malice, deceit, lewdness, envy, slander, arrogance and folly.

verses.zh: 这一切的恶都是从里面出来，且能污秽人。'
verses.en: All these evils come from inside and defile a person.'

verses.zh: 耶稣从那里起身，往推罗、西顿的境内去，进了一家，不愿意人知道，却隐藏不住。
verses.en: Jesus left that place and went to the vicinity of Tyre. He entered a house and did not want anyone to know it; yet he could not keep his presence secret.

verses.zh: 当下，有一个妇人，她的小女儿被污鬼附着，听见耶稣的事，就来俯伏在他脚前。
verses.en: In fact, as soon as she heard about him, a woman whose little daughter was possessed by an impure spirit came and fell at his feet.

verses.zh: 这妇人是希腊人，属叙利腓尼基族。她求耶稣赶出那鬼离开她的女儿。
verses.en: The woman was a Greek, born in Syrian Phoenicia. She begged Jesus to drive the demon out of her daughter.

verses.zh: 耶稣对她说：'让儿女们先吃饱，不好拿儿女的饼丢给狗吃。'
verses.en: 'First let the children eat all they want,' he told her, 'for it is not right to take the children's bread and toss it to the dogs.'

verses.zh: 妇人回答说：'主啊，不错；但是狗在桌子底下也吃孩子们的碎渣儿。'
verses.en: 'Lord,' she replied, 'but even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对她说：'因这句话，你回去吧；鬼已经离开你的女儿了。'
verses.en: Then he told her, 'For such a reply, you may go; the demon has left your daughter.'

verses.zh: 她就回家去，见小孩子躺在床上，鬼已经出去了。
verses.en: She went home and found her child lying on the bed, and the demon gone.

verses.zh: 耶稣又离了推罗的境界，经过西顿，就从低加坡里境内来到加利利海。
verses.en: Then Jesus left the vicinity of Tyre and went through Sidon, down to the Sea of Galilee and into the region of the Decapolis.

verses.zh: 有人带着一个耳聋舌结的人来见耶稣，求他按手在他身上。
verses.en: There some people brought to him a man who was deaf and could hardly talk, and they begged Jesus to place his hand on him.

verses.zh: 耶稣领他离开众人，到一边去，就用指头探他的耳朵，吐唾沫抹他的舌头，
verses.en: After he took him aside, away from the crowd, Jesus put his fingers into the man's ears. Then he spit and touched the man's tongue.

verses.zh: 望天叹息，对他说：'以法大！'就是说：'开了吧！'
verses.en: He looked up to heaven and with a deep sigh said to him, 'Ephphatha!' (which means 'Be opened!').

verses.zh: 他的耳朵就开了，舌结也解了，说话也清楚了。
verses.en: At this, the man's ears were opened, his tongue was loosened and he began to speak plainly.

verses.zh: 耶稣嘱咐他们不要告诉人；但他越发嘱咐，他们越发传扬开了。
verses.en: Jesus commanded them not to tell anyone. But the more he did so, the more they kept talking about it.

verses.zh: 众人分外希奇，说：他所做的事都好，他连聋子也叫他们听见，哑巴也叫他们说话。
verses.en: People were overwhelmed with amazement. He has done everything well, they said. He even makes the deaf hear and the mute speak.

verses.zh: 那时，又有许多人聚集，并没有什么吃的。耶稣叫门徒来，说：
verses.en: During those days another large crowd gathered. Since they had nothing to eat, Jesus called his disciples to him and said,

verses.zh: '我怜悯这众人；因为他们同我在这里已经三天，也没有吃的了。
verses.en: 'I have compassion for these people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat.

verses.zh: 我若打发他们饿着回家，就必在路上困乏，因为其中有从远处来的。'
verses.en: If I send them home hungry, they will collapse on the way, because some of them have come a long distance.'

verses.zh: 门徒回答说：'在这野地，从哪里能得饼，叫这些人吃饱呢？'
verses.en: His disciples answered, 'But where in this remote place can anyone get enough bread to feed them?'

verses.zh: 耶稣问他们说：'你们有多少饼？'他们说：'七个。'
verses.en: 'How many loaves do you have?' Jesus asked. 'Seven,' they replied.

verses.zh: 他吹咐众人坐在地上，就拿着这七个饼祝谢，擘开，递给门徒，叫他们摆开，门徒就摆在众人面前。
verses.en: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. When he had taken the seven loaves and given thanks, he broke them and gave them to his disciples to distribute to the people, and they did so.

verses.zh: 又有几条小鱼；耶稣祝了福，就嚉咐也摆在众人面前。
verses.en: They had a few small fish as well; he gave thanks for them also and told the disciples to distribute them.

verses.zh: 众人都吃，并且吃饱了，收拾剩下的碎饼，有七筐子。
verses.en: The people ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

verses.zh: 人数约有四千。耶稣打发他们走了，
verses.en: About four thousand were present. After he had sent them away,

verses.zh: 随即同门徒上船，来到大玛努他境内。
verses.en: he got into the boat with his disciples and went to the region of Dalmanutha.

verses.zh: 法利赛人出来盘问耶稣，求他从天上显个神迹给他们看，想要试探他。
verses.en: The Pharisees came and began to question Jesus. To test him, they asked him for a sign from heaven.

verses.zh: 耶稣心里深深地叹息，说：'这世代为什么求神迹呢？我实在告诉你们，没有神迹给这世代看。'
verses.en: He sighed deeply and said, 'Why does this generation ask for a sign? Truly I tell you, no sign will be given to it.'

verses.zh: 他就离开他们，又上船往海那边去了。
verses.en: Then he left them, got back into the boat and crossed to the other side.

verses.zh: 门徒忘了带饼；在船上除了一个饼，没有别的食物。
verses.en: The disciples had forgotten to bring bread, except for one loaf they had with them in the boat.

verses.zh: 耶稣嘱咐他们说：'你们要谨慎，防备法利赛人的酵和希律的酵。'
verses.en: 'Be careful,' Jesus warned them. 'Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and that of Herod.'

verses.zh: 他们彼此议论说：'这是因为我们没有饼吧。'
verses.en: They discussed this with one another and said, 'It is because we have no bread.'

verses.zh: 耶稣看出来，就说：'你们为什么因为没有饼就议论呢？你们还不省悟，还不明白吗？你们的心还是愚顽吗？
verses.en: Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked them: 'Why are you talking about having no bread? Do you still not see or understand? Are your hearts hardened?

verses.zh: 你们有眼睛，看不见吗？有耳朵，听不见吗？也不记得吗？
verses.en: Do you have eyes but fail to see, and ears but fail to hear? And don't you remember?

verses.zh: 我擘开那五个饼分给五千人，你们收拾的碎饼装满了多少篮子呢？'他们说：'十二个。'
verses.en: When I broke the five loaves for the five thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?' 'Twelve,' they replied.

verses.zh: '又擘开那七个饼分给四千人，你们收拾的碎饼装满了多少筐子呢？'他们说：'七个。'
verses.en: 'And when I broke the seven loaves for the four thousand, how many basketfuls of pieces did you pick up?' They answered, 'Seven.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们还是不明白吗？'
verses.en: He said to them, 'Do you still not understand?'

verses.zh: 他们来到伯赛大，有人带一个瑕子来，求耶稣摸他。
verses.en: They came to Bethsaida, and some people brought a blind man and begged Jesus to touch him.

verses.zh: 耶稣拉着瑕子的手，领他到村外，就吐唾沫在他眼睛上，按手在他身上，问他说：'你看见什么了？'
verses.en: He took the blind man by the hand and led him outside the village. When he had spit on the man's eyes and put his hands on him, Jesus asked, 'Do you see anything?'

verses.zh: 他就抬头一看，说：'我看见人了；他们好像树木，并且行走。'
verses.en: He looked up and said, 'I see people; they look like trees walking around.'

verses.zh: 随后又按手在他眼睛上，他定睛一看，就复了原，样样都看得清楚了。
verses.en: Once more Jesus put his hands on the man's eyes. Then his eyes were opened, his sight was restored, and he saw everything clearly.

verses.zh: 耶稣打发他回家，说：'连这村子你也不要进去。'
verses.en: Jesus sent him home, saying, 'Don't even go into the village.'

verses.zh: 耶稣和门徒出去，往凯撒利亚腓利比的村庄去。在路上问门徒说：'人说我是谁？'
verses.en: Jesus and his disciples went on to the villages around Caesarea Philippi. On the way he asked them, 'Who do people say I am?'

verses.zh: 他们说：'有人说是施洗的约翰；有人说是以利亚；又有人说是先知里的一位。'
verses.en: They replied, 'Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, one of the prophets.'

verses.zh: '你们说我是谁？'彼得回答说：'你是基督。'
verses.en: 'But what about you?' he asked. 'Who do you say I am?' Peter answered, 'You are the Messiah.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就禁戒他们，不要告诉人。
verses.en: Jesus warned them not to tell anyone about him.

verses.zh: 从此，他教训他们说：'人子必须受许多的苦，被长老、祭司长和文士弃绝，并且被杀，过三天复活。'
verses.en: He then began to teach them that the Son of Man must suffer many things and be rejected by the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and after three days rise again.

verses.zh: 耶稣明明地说这话，彼得就拉着他，勇敢地劝他。
verses.en: He spoke plainly about this, and Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him.

verses.zh: 耶稣转过来，看着门徒，就责备彼得说：'撒但，退我后边去吧！因为你不体贴神的意思，只体贴人的意思。'
verses.en: But when Jesus turned and looked at his disciples, he rebuked Peter. 'Get behind me, Satan!' he said. 'You do not have in mind the concerns of God, but merely human concerns.'

verses.zh: 于是叫众人和门徒来，对他们说：若有人要跟从我，就当舍己，背起他的十字架，来跟从我。
verses.en: Then he called the crowd to him along with his disciples and said: Whoever wants to be my disciple must deny themselves and take up their cross and follow me.

verses.zh: 因为，凡要救自己生命（或作：灵魂；下同）的，必丧掉生命；凡为我和福音丧掉生命的，必救了生命。
verses.en: For whoever wants to save their life will lose it, but whoever loses their life for me and for the gospel will save it.

verses.zh: 人即使赢得全世界，赔上自己的生命，有什么益处呢？
verses.en: What good is it for someone to gain the whole world, yet forfeit their soul?

verses.zh: 人还能拿什么换生命呢？
verses.en: Or what can anyone give in exchange for their soul?

verses.zh: 凡在这淫乱罪恶的世代，把我和我的道当作可耖的，人子在他父的荣耀里，同圣天使降临的时候，也要把那人当作可耖的。
verses.en: If anyone is ashamed of me and my words in this adulterous and sinful generation, the Son of Man will be ashamed of them when he comes in his Father's glory with the holy angels.

verses.zh: 耶稣又对他们说：'我实在告诉你们，站在这里的，有人在没尝死味以前，必看见神的国大有能力临到。'
verses.en: And he said to them, 'Truly I tell you, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see that the kingdom of God has come with power.'

verses.zh: 过了六天，耶稣带着彼得、雅各、约翰暗暗地上了高山，就在他们面前变了形像，
verses.en: After six days Jesus took Peter, James and John with him and led them up a high mountain, where they were all alone. There he was transfigured before them.

verses.zh: 衣服放光，极其洁白，地上漂布的，没有一个能漂得那样白。
verses.en: His clothes became dazzling white, whiter than anyone in the world could bleach them.

verses.zh: 忽然，有以利亚同摩西向他们显现，并且和耶稣说话。
verses.en: And there appeared before them Elijah and Moses, who were talking with Jesus.

verses.zh: 彼得对耶稣说：'拉比（拉比就是夫子），我们在这里真好！可以搭三座棚，一座为你，一座为摩西，一座为以利亚。'
verses.en: Peter said to Jesus, 'Rabbi, it is good for us to be here. Let us put up three shelters—one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah.'

verses.zh: 彼得不知道说什么才好，因为他们甚是惧怕。
verses.en: (He did not know what to say, they were so frightened.)

verses.zh: 有一朵云彩遮盖他们；也有声音从云彩里出来，说：'这是我的爱子，你们要听他。'
verses.en: Then a cloud appeared and covered them, and a voice came from the cloud: 'This is my Son, whom I love. Listen to him!'

verses.zh: 门徒忽然周围一看，不再见一人，只见耶稣同他们在那里。
verses.en: Suddenly, when they looked around, they no longer saw anyone with them except Jesus.

verses.zh: 下山的时候，耶稣嘱咐他们说：'人子还没有从死里复活，你们不要将所看见的告诉人。'
verses.en: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus gave them orders not to tell anyone what they had seen until the Son of Man had risen from the dead.

verses.zh: 门徒将这话存记在心，彼此讨论什么是从死里复活的意思。
verses.en: They kept the matter to themselves, discussing what 'rising from the dead' meant.

verses.zh: 他们问耶稣说：'文士为什么说以利亚必须先来？'
verses.en: And they asked him, 'Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'以利亚固然先来复兴万事；经上不是指着人子说，他要受许多的苦，被人轻民呢？
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'To be sure, Elijah does come first, and restores all things. Why then is it written that the Son of Man must suffer much and be rejected?

verses.zh: 但我告诉你们，以利亚已经来了，他们也任意待他，正如经上所指着他的话。'
verses.en: But I tell you, Elijah has come, and they have done to him everything they wished, just as it is written about him.'

verses.zh: 耶稣到了门徒那里，看见有许多人围着他们，又有文士和他们辩论。
verses.en: When they came to the other disciples, they saw a large crowd around them and the teachers of the law arguing with them.

verses.zh: 众人一见耶稣，都甚希奇，就跑上去问他的安。
verses.en: As soon as all the people saw Jesus, they were overwhelmed with wonder and ran to greet him.

verses.zh: '你们和他们辩论的是什么？'耶稣问他们。
verses.en: 'What are you arguing with them about?' he asked.

verses.zh: 众人中间有一个人回答说：'夫子，我带了我的儿子到你这里来，他被哑巴鬼附着。
verses.en: A man in the crowd answered, 'Teacher, I brought you my son, who is possessed by a spirit that has robbed him of speech.

verses.zh: 无论在哪里，鬼捉弄他，把他摔倒；他就口中流沫，咬牙切齿，身体枯干。我请过你的门徒把鬼赶出去，他们却是不能。'
verses.en: Whenever it seizes him, it throws him to the ground. He foams at the mouth, gnashes his teeth and becomes rigid. I asked your disciples to drive out the spirit, but they could not.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'嘘！不信的世代啊，我在你们这里要到几时呢？我忍耐你们要到几时呢？把他带到我这里来吧！'
verses.en: 'You unbelieving generation,' Jesus replied, 'how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy to me.'

verses.zh: 他们就把他带了来。他一见耶稣，鬼便叫他重重地抽风，倒在地上，翻来覆去，口中流沫。
verses.en: So they brought him. When the spirit saw Jesus, it immediately threw the boy into a convulsion. He fell to the ground and rolled around, foaming at the mouth.

verses.zh: 耶稣问他父亲说：'他得这病有多少日子呢？'回答说：'从小的时候。
verses.en: Jesus asked the boy's father, 'How long has he been like this?' 'From childhood,' he answered.

verses.zh: 鬼屡次把他扔在火里、水里，要灭他。你若能做什么，求你怜悯我们，帮助我们。'
verses.en: 'It has often thrown him into fire or water to kill him. But if you can do anything, take pity on us and help us.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：你若能信，在信的人，凡事都能。
verses.en: If you can? said Jesus. Everything is possible for one who believes.

verses.zh: 孩子的父亲立时喊着说（有古卷：立时流泪喊着说）：'我信！但我信不足，求主帮助。'
verses.en: Immediately the boy's father exclaimed, 'I do believe; help me overcome my unbelief!'

verses.zh: 耶稣看见众人都跑上来，就斥责那污鬼，说：'你这聚而不言的鬼，我吹咐你从他里面出来，再不要进去！'
verses.en: When Jesus saw that a crowd was running to the scene, he rebuked the impure spirit. 'You deaf and mute spirit,' he said, 'I command you, come out of him and never enter him again.'

verses.zh: 那鬼喊叫，使孩子大大地抽了一阵风，就出来了。孩子好像死了一般。许多人都说：'他是死了。'
verses.en: The spirit shrieked, convulsed him violently and came out. The boy looked so much like a corpse that many said, 'He's dead.'

verses.zh: 但耶稣拉着他的手，扛他起来，他就站起来了。
verses.en: But Jesus took him by the hand and lifted him to his feet, and he stood up.

verses.zh: 耶稣进了屋子，门徒就暗暗地问他说：'我们为什么不能赶出他去呢？'
verses.en: After Jesus had gone indoors, his disciples asked him privately, 'Why couldn't we drive it out?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'非用祷告（有古卷在此有：禁食），这一类的鬼总不能出来（或作：不能赶他出来）。'
verses.en: He replied, 'This kind can come out only by prayer.'

verses.zh: 他们离开那地方，经过加利利；耶稣不愿意人知道。
verses.en: They left that place and passed through Galilee. Jesus did not want anyone to know where they were,

verses.zh: 于是教训门徒，说：'人子将要被交在人手里，他们要杀害他；被杀以后，过三天他要复活。'
verses.en: because he was teaching his disciples. He said to them, 'The Son of Man is going to be delivered into the hands of men. They will kill him, and after three days he will rise.'

verses.zh: 门徒却不明白这话，又不敢问他。
verses.en: But they did not understand what he meant and were afraid to ask him about it.

verses.zh: 他们来到迦百农；耶稣在屋里问门徒说：'你们在路上讨论的是什么？'
verses.en: They came to Capernaum. When he was in the house, he asked them, 'What were you arguing about on the road?'

verses.zh: 门徒不作声，因为他们在路上彼此争论谁为大。
verses.en: But they kept quiet because on the way they had argued about who was the greatest.

verses.zh: 耶稣坐下，叫十二个门徒来，说：若有人愿意作首先的，他必作众人末后的，作众人的用人。
verses.en: Sitting down, Jesus called the Twelve and said, Anyone who wants to be first must be the very last, and the servant of all.

verses.zh: 于是领过一个小孩子来，叫他站在门徒中间，又抱起他来，对他们说：
verses.en: He took a little child whom he placed among them. Taking the child in his arms, he said to them,

verses.zh: '凡为我名接待一个像这小孩子的，就是接待我；凡接待我的，不是接待我，乃是接待那差遣我来的。'
verses.en: 'Whoever welcomes one of these little children in my name welcomes me; and whoever welcomes me does not welcome me but the one who sent me.'

verses.zh: 约翰对耶稣说：'夫子，我们看见一个人奉你的名赶鬼，我们就禁止他，因为他不跟从我们。'
verses.en: 'Teacher,' said John, 'we saw someone driving out demons in your name and we told him to stop, because he was not one of us.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'不要禁止他；因为没有人奉我的名行异能，反倒轻易毁谤我。
verses.en: 'Do not stop him,' Jesus said. 'For no one who does a miracle in my name can in the next moment say anything bad about me,

verses.zh: 不敌挡我们的，就是帮助我们的。
verses.en: for whoever is not against us is for us.

verses.zh: 凡因你们是属基督，给你们一杯水喝的，我实在告诉你们，他不能不得赏赐。'
verses.en: Truly I tell you, anyone who gives you a cup of water in my name because you belong to the Messiah will certainly not lose their reward.

verses.zh: '凡使这信我的一个小子跌倒的，倘若把大磨石拴在这人的颈项上，扔在海里，还强如他。
verses.en: 'If anyone causes one of these little ones—those who believe in me—to stumble, it would be better for them if a large millstone were hung around their neck and they were thrown into the sea.

verses.zh: 倚若你一只手叫你跌倒，就把它砧下来；你缺了肢体进入永生，强如有两只手落在地狱，入那不灭的火里去。
verses.en: If your hand causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life maimed than with two hands to go into hell, where the fire never goes out.

verses.zh: [在那里，虫是不死的，火是不灭的。]
verses.en: [where 'the worms that eat them do not die, and the fire is not quenched.']

verses.zh: 倚若你一只脚叫你跌倒，就把它砧下来；你瘘腿进入永生，强如有两只脚被丢在地狱里。
verses.en: And if your foot causes you to stumble, cut it off. It is better for you to enter life crippled than to have two feet and be thrown into hell.

verses.zh: [在那里，虫是不死的，火是不灭的。]
verses.en: [where 'the worms that eat them do not die, and the fire is not quenched.']

verses.zh: 倚若你一只眼叫你跌倒，就去掉它；你只有一只眼进入神的国，强如有两只眼被丢在地狱里。
verses.en: And if your eye causes you to stumble, pluck it out. It is better for you to enter the kingdom of God with one eye than to have two eyes and be thrown into hell,

verses.zh: 在那里，虫是不死的，火是不灭的。
verses.en: where 'the worms that eat them do not die, and the fire is not quenched.'

verses.zh: 因为必用火当盐腔各人。（有古卷在此有：凡祭物必用盐腔之）
verses.en: Everyone will be salted with fire.

verses.zh: 盐本是好的，若失了味，可用什么叫它再咸呢？你们里头应当有盐，彼此和睦。
verses.en: Salt is good, but if it loses its saltiness, how can you make it salty again? Have salt among yourselves, and be at peace with each other.

verses.zh: 耶稣从那里起身，来到猶太的境界并约旦河外。众人又聚集到他那里，他又照常教训他们。
verses.en: Jesus then left that place and went into the region of Judea and across the Jordan. Again crowds of people came to him, and as was his custom, he taught them.

verses.zh: 有法利赛人来问他说：'人休妻可以不可以？'意思要试探他。
verses.en: Some Pharisees came and tested him by asking, 'Is it lawful for a man to divorce his wife?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'摩西吵咐你们的是什么？'
verses.en: 'What did Moses command you?' he replied.

verses.zh: 他们说：'摩西许人写休书休妻。'
verses.en: They said, 'Moses permitted a man to write a certificate of divorce and send her away.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'摩西因为你们的心硬，所以写这条文给你们；
verses.en: 'It was because your hearts were hard that Moses wrote you this law,' Jesus replied.

verses.zh: 但从起初创造的时候，神造人是造男造女。
verses.en: But at the beginning of creation God made them male and female.

verses.zh: 因此，人要离开父母，与妻子联合，
verses.en: For this reason a man will leave his father and mother and be united to his wife,

verses.zh: 二人成为一体。既然如此，夫妻不再是两个人，乃是一体的了。
verses.en: and the two will become one flesh. So they are no longer two, but one flesh.

verses.zh: 所以，神配合的，人不可分开。'
verses.en: Therefore what God has joined together, let no one separate.'

verses.zh: 到了屋里，门徒就问他这事。
verses.en: When they were in the house again, the disciples asked Jesus about this.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'凡休妻再娶的，就是犯奸淫连累她；
verses.en: He answered, 'Anyone who divorces his wife and marries another woman commits adultery against her.

verses.zh: 妻子若离弃丈夫再娶的，也是犯奸淫了。'
verses.en: And if she divorces her husband and marries another man, she commits adultery.'

verses.zh: 有人带着小孩子来见耶稣，要他摸他们，门徒便责备那些人。
verses.en: People were bringing little children to Jesus for him to place his hands on them, but the disciples rebuked them.

verses.zh: 耶稣看见就恼怒，对门徒说：让小孩子到我这里来，不要禁止他们，因为在神国的，正是这样的人。
verses.en: When Jesus saw this, he was indignant. He said to them, Let the little children come to me, and do not hinder them, for the kingdom of God belongs to such as these.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，凡不像小孩子接受神国的，断不能进去。
verses.en: Truly I tell you, anyone who will not receive the kingdom of God like a little child will never enter it.

verses.zh: 于是抱着小孩子，给他们按手，为他们祝福。
verses.en: And he took the children in his arms, placed his hands on them and blessed them.

verses.zh: 耶稣出来行路的时候，有一个人跑来，跡在他面前，问他说：'良善的夫子，我当做什么事才可以承受永生？'
verses.en: As Jesus started on his way, a man ran up to him and fell on his knees before him. 'Good teacher,' he asked, 'what must I do to inherit eternal life?'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'你为什么称我是良善的？除了神一位之外，再没有良善的。
verses.en: 'Why do you call me good?' Jesus answered. 'No one is good—except God alone.

verses.zh: 诫命你是晓得的：不可杀人；不可奸淫；不可偷盗；不可作假见证；不可亏负人；当孝敬父母。'
verses.en: You know the commandments: You shall not murder, you shall not commit adultery, you shall not steal, you shall not give false testimony, you shall not defraud, honor your father and mother.'

verses.zh: 他对耶稣说：'夫子，这一切我从小都遵守了。'
verses.en: 'Teacher,' he declared, 'all these I have kept since I was a boy.'

verses.zh: 耶稣看着他，就爱他，对他说：'你还缺少一件：去卖你所有的，分给穷人，就必有财宝在天上；你还要来跟从我。'
verses.en: Jesus looked at him and loved him. 'One thing you lack,' he said. 'Go, sell everything you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven. Then come, follow me.'

verses.zh: 他听见这话，脸上就变了色，忧忧愁愁地走了，因为他的产业很多。
verses.en: At this the man's face fell. He went away sad, because he had great wealth.

verses.zh: 耶稣周围一看，对门徒说：'有钱财的人进神的国是何等的难哪！'
verses.en: Jesus looked around and said to his disciples, 'How hard it is for the rich to enter the kingdom of God!'

verses.zh: 门徒希奇他的话。耶稣又对他们说：'小子，倡靠钱财的人进神的国是何等的难哪！
verses.en: The disciples were amazed at his words. But Jesus said again, 'Children, how hard it is to enter the kingdom of God!

verses.zh: 骆驼穿过针的眼，比财主进神的国还容易呢。'
verses.en: It is easier for a camel to go through the eye of a needle than for someone who is rich to enter the kingdom of God.'

verses.zh: 门徒就分外希奇，对他说：'这样谁能得救呢？'
verses.en: The disciples were even more amazed, and said to each other, 'Who then can be saved?'

verses.zh: 耶稣看着他们说：在人是不能，在神却不然，因为神凡事都能。
verses.en: Jesus looked at them and said, With man this is impossible, but not with God; all things are possible with God.

verses.zh: 彼得就对他说：'看哪，我们已经离开了所有的跟从你了。'
verses.en: Then Peter spoke up, 'We have left everything to follow you!'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'我实在告诉你们，人为我和福音离开房屋，或是弟兄、姐妹、父母、儿女、田地，
verses.en: 'Truly I tell you,' Jesus replied, 'no one who has left home or brothers or sisters or mother or father or children or fields for me and the gospel

verses.zh: 没有在今世不得百倍的，就是房屋、弟兄、姐妹、母亲、儿女、田地，并且要受逼迫，在来世必得永生。
verses.en: will fail to receive a hundred times as much in this present age: homes, brothers, sisters, mothers, children and fields—along with persecutions—and in the age to come eternal life.

verses.zh: 然而，有许多在前的，将要在后；在后的，将要在前。'
verses.en: But many who are first will be last, and the last first.'

verses.zh: 他们行路上耶路撒冷去。耶稣在前头走，门徒就希奇，跟从的人也害怕。耶稣又叫过十二个门徒来，把自己将要遇到的事告诉他们说：
verses.en: They were on their way up to Jerusalem, with Jesus leading the way, and the disciples were astonished, while those who followed were afraid. Again he took the Twelve aside and told them what was going to happen to him.

verses.zh: '看哪，我们上耶路撒冷去，人子将要被交给祭司长和文士，他们要定他死罪，交给外邦人。
verses.en: 'We are going up to Jerusalem,' he said, 'and the Son of Man will be delivered over to the chief priests and the teachers of the law. They will condemn him to death and will hand him over to the Gentiles,

verses.zh: 他们要戏弄他，吐唾沫在他脸上，鞭打他，杀害他。过三天，他要复活。'
verses.en: who will mock him and spit on him, flog him and kill him. Three days later he will rise.'

verses.zh: 西庇太的儿子雅各、约翰进前来，对耶稣说：'夫子，我们无论求你什么，愿你给我们做。'
verses.en: Then James and John, the sons of Zebedee, came to him. 'Teacher,' they said, 'we want you to do for us whatever we ask.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'要我给你们做什么？'
verses.en: 'What do you want me to do for you?' he asked.

verses.zh: 他们说：'赐我们在你的荣耀里，一个坐在你右边，一个坐在你左边。'
verses.en: They replied, 'Let one of us sit at your right and the other at your left in your glory.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们不知道所求的是什么。我所喝的杯，你们能喝吗？我所受的洗，你们能受吗？'
verses.en: 'You don't know what you are asking,' Jesus said. 'Can you drink the cup I drink or be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with?'

verses.zh: 他们说：'我们能。'耶稣说：'我所喝的杯，你们也要喝；我所受的洗，你们也要受；
verses.en: 'We can,' they answered. Jesus said to them, 'You will drink the cup I drink and be baptized with the baptism I am baptized with,

verses.zh: 只是坐在我的左右，不是我可以赐的，乃是为谁预备的，就赐给谁。'
verses.en: but to sit at my right or left is not for me to grant. These places belong to those for whom they have been prepared.'

verses.zh: 那十个门徒听见，就恼怒雅各、约翰。
verses.en: When the ten heard about this, they became indignant with James and John.

verses.zh: 耶稣叫他们来，对他们说：'你们知道，外邦人有尊为君王的，治理他们；有大臣操权管束他们。
verses.en: Jesus called them together and said, 'You know that those who are regarded as rulers of the Gentiles lord it over them, and their high officials exercise authority over them.

verses.zh: 只是在你们中间，不是这样。你们中间，谁愿为大，就必作你们的用人；
verses.en: Not so with you. Instead, whoever wants to become great among you must be your servant,

verses.zh: 在你们中间，谁愿为首，就必作众人的仆人。
verses.en: and whoever wants to be first must be slave of all.

verses.zh: 因为人子来，并不是要受人的服事，乃是要服事人，并且要舍命作多人的赎价。'
verses.en: For even the Son of Man did not come to be served, but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.'

verses.zh: 到了耶利哥；耶稣同门徒并许多人出耶利哥的时候，有一个讨饭的瑕子，是巴底马的儿子巴底马，坐在路旁。
verses.en: Then they came to Jericho. As Jesus and his disciples, together with a large crowd, were leaving the city, a blind man, Bartimaeus (which means 'son of Timaeus'), was sitting by the roadside begging.

verses.zh: 他听见是拿撒勒人耶稣，就喊着说：'大卫的子孙耶稣啊！可怜悯我！'
verses.en: When he heard that it was Jesus of Nazareth, he began to shout, 'Jesus, Son of David, have mercy on me!'

verses.zh: 有许多人责备他，不许他作声。他却越发大声喊着说：'大卫的子孙啊！可怜悯我！'
verses.en: Many rebuked him and told him to be quiet, but he shouted all the more, 'Son of David, have mercy on me!'

verses.zh: 耶稣就站住，说：'叫过他来。'他们就叫那瑕子，对他说：'放心，起来！他叫你啦！'
verses.en: Jesus stopped and said, 'Call him.' So they called to the blind man, 'Cheer up! On your feet! He's calling you.'

verses.zh: 瑕子就丢下衣服，跳起来，走到耶稣那里。
verses.en: Throwing his cloak aside, he jumped to his feet and came to Jesus.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'要我为你做什么？'瑕子说：'拉波尼（拉波尼就是夫子），我要能看见。'
verses.en: 'What do you want me to do for you?' Jesus asked him. The blind man said, 'Rabbi, I want to see.'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你去吧！你的信救了你了。'瑕子立刻看见了，就在路上跟随耶稣。
verses.en: 'Go,' said Jesus, 'your faith has healed you.' Immediately he received his sight and followed Jesus along the road.

verses.zh: 耶稣和门徒将近耶路撒冷，到了伯法其和伯大尼，在橄榄山那里；耶稣就打发两个门徒，
verses.en: As they approached Jerusalem and came to Bethphage and Bethany at the Mount of Olives, Jesus sent two of his disciples,

verses.zh: 对他们说：'你们往对面村子里去，一进去的时候，必看见一匹驴骒拴在那里，是从来没有人骑过的，可以解开，牵来。
verses.en: saying to them, 'Go to the village ahead of you, and just as you enter it, you will find a colt tied there, which no one has ever ridden. Untie it and bring it here.

verses.zh: 若有人对你们说：为什么做这事？你们就说：主要用他。那人必立时让你们牵来。'
verses.en: If anyone asks you, Why are you doing this? say, The Lord needs it and will send it back here shortly.'

verses.zh: 他们去了，便看见一匹驴骒拴在门外街道上，就把它解开。
verses.en: They went and found a colt outside in the street, tied at a doorway. As they untied it,

verses.zh: 在那里站着的人，有几个说：'你们解驴骒做什么？'
verses.en: some people standing there asked, 'What are you doing, untying that colt?'

verses.zh: 门徒照着耶稣所说的回答，那些人就任凭他们牵去了。
verses.en: They answered as Jesus had told them to, and the people let them go.

verses.zh: 他们把驴骒牵到耶稣那里，把衣服搭在上面，耶稣就骑上。
verses.en: When they brought the colt to Jesus and threw their cloaks over it, he sat on it.

verses.zh: 有许多人把衣服铺在路上，也有人把田间的树枝砧下来，铺在路上。
verses.en: Many people spread their cloaks on the road, while others spread branches they had cut in the fields.

verses.zh: 前行后随的人都喊着说：'和撒那（和撒那原有求救的意思）！奉主名来的是应当称颂的！
verses.en: Those who went ahead and those who followed shouted, 'Hosanna!' 'Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!'

verses.zh: 那将要来的我祖大卫之国是应当称颂的！高高在上和撒那！'
verses.en: 'Blessed is the coming kingdom of our father David!' 'Hosanna in the highest heaven!'

verses.zh: 耶稣进了耶路撒冷，入了圣殿，周围看了各样物件。天色已晚，就和十二个门徒出城，往伯大尼去了。
verses.en: Jesus entered Jerusalem and went into the temple courts. He looked around at everything, but since it was already late, he went out to Bethany with the Twelve.

verses.zh: 第二天，他们从伯大尼出来，耶稣饿了。
verses.en: The next day as they were leaving Bethany, Jesus was hungry.

verses.zh: 远远地看见一棵无花果树，树上有叶子，就往那里去，或者在树上可以找着什么。到了树下，竟找不着什么，不过是叶子，因为不是收无花果的时候。
verses.en: Seeing in the distance a fig tree in leaf, he went to find out if it had any fruit. When he reached it, he found nothing but leaves, because it was not the season for figs.

verses.zh: 耶稣就对树说：'从今以后，永没有人吃你的果子。'他的门徒也听见了。
verses.en: Then he said to the tree, 'May no one ever eat fruit from you again.' And his disciples heard him say it.

verses.zh: 他们来到耶路撒冷。耶稣进入圣殿，赶出殿里做买卖的人，推倒兑换银钱之人的桌子，和卖鸽子之人的板凳；
verses.en: On reaching Jerusalem, Jesus entered the temple courts and began driving out those who were buying and selling there. He overturned the tables of the money changers and the benches of those selling doves,

verses.zh: 也不许人拿着器皿从殿里经过；
verses.en: and would not allow anyone to carry merchandise through the temple courts.

verses.zh: 便教训他们说：'经上不是记着说：我的殿必称为万国祷告的殿吗？你们倒使它成了贼窝了。'
verses.en: And as he taught them, he said, 'Is it not written: My house will be called a house of prayer for all nations? But you have made it a den of robbers.'

verses.zh: 祭司长和文士听见这话，就想法子要除灭耶稣，却又怕他，因为众人都希奇他的教训。
verses.en: The chief priests and the teachers of the law heard this and began looking for a way to kill him, for they feared him, because the whole crowd was amazed at his teaching.

verses.zh: 每天晚上，耶稣出城去。
verses.en: When evening came, Jesus and his disciples went out of the city.

verses.zh: 早晨，他们从那里经过，看见无花果树连根都枯干了。
verses.en: In the morning, as they went along, they saw the fig tree withered from the roots.

verses.zh: 彼得想起耶稣的话，就对他说：'拉比，请看！你所咒诅的无花果树，已经枯干了。'
verses.en: Peter remembered and said to Jesus, 'Rabbi, look! The fig tree you cursed has withered!'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'你们当信服神。
verses.en: 'Have faith in God,' Jesus answered.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，无论何人对这座山说：你挚起来，投在海里！他若心里不疑惑，只信他所说的必成，就必给他成了。
verses.en: Truly I tell you, if anyone says to this mountain, Go, throw yourself into the sea, and does not doubt in their heart but believes that what they say will happen, it will be done for them.

verses.zh: 所以我告诉你们：凡你们祷告祈求的，无论是什么，只要信是得着的，就必得着。
verses.en: Therefore I tell you, whatever you ask for in prayer, believe that you have received it, and it will be yours.

verses.zh: 你们站着祷告的时候，若想起有人得罪你们，就当饶恕他，好叫你们在天上的父也饶恕你们的过犯。
verses.en: And when you stand praying, if you hold anything against anyone, forgive them, so that your Father in heaven may forgive you your sins.

verses.zh: [你们若不饶恕人，你们在天上的父也不饶恕你们的过犯。]
verses.en: [But if you do not forgive, neither will your Father who is in heaven forgive your sins.]

verses.zh: 他们又来到耶路撒冷。耶稣在殿里行走的时候，祭司长和文士并长老进前来，
verses.en: They arrived again in Jerusalem, and while Jesus was walking in the temple courts, the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders came to him.

verses.zh: 问他说：'你仗着什么权柄做这些事？给你这权柄的是谁呢？'
verses.en: 'By what authority are you doing these things?' they asked. 'And who gave you authority to do this?'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'我要问你们一句话，你们回答我，我就告诉你们我仗着什么权柄做这些事。
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I am doing these things.

verses.zh: 约翰的洗礼是从天上来的？是从人间来的呢？你们可以回答我。'
verses.en: John's baptism—was it from heaven, or of human origin? Tell me!'

verses.zh: 他们彼此商议说：'我们若说从天上来，他必说：这样，你们为什么不信他呢？
verses.en: They discussed it among themselves and said, 'If we say, From heaven, he will ask, Then why didn't you believe him?

verses.zh: 若说从人间来，却又怕百姓，因为众人真以约翰为先知。'
verses.en: But if we say, Of human origin...' (They feared the people, for everyone held that John really was a prophet.)

verses.zh: 于是回答耶稣说：'我们不知道。'耶稣说：'我也不告诉你们我仗着什么权柄做这些事。'
verses.en: So they answered Jesus, 'We don't know.' Jesus said, 'Neither will I tell you by what authority I am doing these things.'

verses.zh: 耶稣就用比喻对他们说：'有人栽了一个葡萄园，周围圈上篡笆，挖了一个压酒池，盖了一座楼，租给园户，就往外国去了。
verses.en: Jesus then began to speak to them in parables: 'A man planted a vineyard. He put a wall around it, dug a pit for the winepress and built a watchtower. Then he rented the vineyard to some farmers and moved to another place.

verses.zh: 到了时候，打发一个仆人到园户那里，要从园户收葡萄园的果子。
verses.en: At harvest time he sent a servant to the tenants to collect from them some of the fruit of the vineyard.

verses.zh: 园户拿住他，打了他，叫他空手回去。
verses.en: But they seized him, beat him and sent him away empty-handed.

verses.zh: 再打发一个仆人到他们那里；他们打伤他的头，并且凌辱他。
verses.en: Then he sent another servant to them; they struck this man on the head and treated him shamefully.

verses.zh: 又打发一个仆人去，他们就杀了他。后又打发好些仆人去，有被他们打的，有被他们杀的。
verses.en: He sent still another, and that one they killed. He sent many others; some of them they beat, others they killed.

verses.zh: 园主还有一位，就是他的爱子；最后又打发他去，意思说：他们必尊敬我的儿子。
verses.en: He had one left to send, a son, whom he loved. He sent him last of all, saying, They will respect my son.

verses.zh: 不料，那些园户彼此说：这是承受产业的。来吧，我们杀他，产业就归我们了！
verses.en: But the tenants said to one another, This is the heir. Come, let's kill him, and the inheritance will be ours.

verses.zh: 于是拿住他，杀了他，把他丢在葡萄园外。
verses.en: So they took him and killed him, and threw him out of the vineyard.

verses.zh: 这样，葡萄园的主人要怎么办呢？他要来除灭那些园户，将葡萄园转给别人。
verses.en: What then will the owner of the vineyard do? He will come and kill those tenants and give the vineyard to others.

verses.zh: 经上写着说：匠人所弃的石头已作了房角的头块石头。
verses.en: Haven't you read this passage of Scripture: The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone;

verses.zh: 这是主所做的，在我们眼中看为希奇。'
verses.en: the Lord has done this, and it is marvelous in our eyes'?

verses.zh: 他们看出这比喻是指着他们说的，就想要捕拿他，只是怕众人，于是离开他走了。
verses.en: Then the chief priests, the teachers of the law and the elders looked for a way to arrest him because they knew he had spoken the parable against them. But they were afraid of the crowd; so they left him and went away.

verses.zh: 后来，他们打发几个法利赛人和几个希律党的人到耶稣那里，要就着他的话陷害他。
verses.en: Later they sent some of the Pharisees and Herodians to Jesus to catch him in his words.

verses.zh: 他们来了，就对他说：'夫子，我们知道你是诚实的，什么人你都不徐私；因为你不看人的外貌，乃是诚诚实实传神的道。纳税给凯撒可以不可以？
verses.en: They came to him and said, 'Teacher, we know that you are a man of integrity. You aren't swayed by others, because you pay no attention to who they are; but you teach the way of God in accordance with the truth. Is it right to pay the imperial tax to Caesar or not?

verses.zh: 我们该纳不该纳？'耶稣看出他们的假意，就对他们说：'你们为什么试探我？拿一个银钱来给我看！'
verses.en: Should we pay or shouldn't we?' But Jesus knew their hypocrisy. 'Why are you trying to trap me?' he asked. 'Bring me a denarius and let me look at it.'

verses.zh: 他们就拿了来。耶稣说：'这像和这号是谁的？'他们说：'是凯撒的。'
verses.en: They brought the coin, and he asked them, 'Whose image is this? And whose inscription?' 'Caesar's,' they replied.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'凯撒的物当归给凯撒，神的物当归给神。'他们就很希奇他。
verses.en: Then Jesus said to them, 'Give back to Caesar what is Caesar's and to God what is God's.' And they were amazed at him.

verses.zh: 撞都嘉人常说没有复活的事。他们来问耶稣说：
verses.en: Then the Sadducees, who say there is no resurrection, came to him with a question.

verses.zh: '夫子，摩西为我们写着说：人若死了，留下妻子，没有孩子，他兄弟当娶他的妻，为哥哥生子立后。
verses.en: 'Teacher,' they said, 'Moses wrote for us that if a man's brother dies and leaves a wife but no children, the man must marry the widow and raise up offspring for his brother.

verses.zh: 有弟兄七人，第一个娶了妻，死了，没有留下孩子。
verses.en: Now there were seven brothers. The first one married and died without leaving any children.

verses.zh: 第二个娶了她，也死了，没有留下孩子。第三个也是这样。
verses.en: The second one married the widow, but he also died, leaving no child. It was the same with the third.

verses.zh: 那七个人都没有留下孩子；末后，那妇人也死了。
verses.en: In fact, none of the seven left any children. Last of all, the woman died too.

verses.zh: 当复活的时候，她是哪一个的妻子呢？因为他们七个人都娶过她。'
verses.en: At the resurrection whose wife will she be, since the seven were married to her?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们所以错了，岂不是因为不明白圣经，不晓得神的大能吗？
verses.en: Jesus replied, 'Are you not in error because you do not know the Scriptures or the power of God?

verses.zh: 人从死里复活，也不娶也不嫁，乃像天上的使者一样。
verses.en: When the dead rise, they will neither marry nor be given in marriage; they will be like the angels in heaven.

verses.zh: 论到死人复活，你们没有念过摩西的书荆棘篇中，神对摩西怎么说的吗？说：我是亚伯拉罕的神，以撒的神，雅各的神。
verses.en: Now about the dead rising—have you not read in the Book of Moses, in the account of the burning bush, how God said to him, I am the God of Abraham, the God of Isaac, and the God of Jacob?

verses.zh: 神不是死人的神，乃是活人的神。你们是大错了。'
verses.en: He is not the God of the dead, but of the living. You are badly mistaken!'

verses.zh: 有一个文士来，听见他们辩论，晒得耶稣回答的好，就问他说：'诫命中哪是第一要紧的呢？'
verses.en: One of the teachers of the law came and heard them debating. Noticing that Jesus had given them a good answer, he asked him, 'Of all the commandments, which is the most important?'

verses.zh: 耶稣回答说：'第一要紧的就是说：以色列啊，你要听，主我们神是独一的主。
verses.en: 'The most important one,' answered Jesus, 'is this: Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one.

verses.zh: 你要尽心、尽性、尽意、尽力爱主你的神。
verses.en: Love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.

verses.zh: 其次就是说：要爱人如己。再没有比这两条诫命更大的了。
verses.en: The second is this: Love your neighbor as yourself. There is no commandment greater than these.

verses.zh: 那文士对耶稣说：'夫子说，神是一位，实在不错；除了他以外，再没有别的神；
verses.en: 'Well said, teacher,' the man replied. 'You are right in saying that God is one and there is no other but him.

verses.zh: 并且尽心、尽智、尽力爱他，又爱人如己，就比一切燔祭和各样祭祀好的多。'
