verses.en: To love him with all your heart, with all your understanding and with all your strength, and to love your neighbor as yourself is more important than all burnt offerings and sacrifices.'

verses.zh: 耶稣见他回答的有智慧，就对他说：'你离神的国不远了。'从此以后，没有人敢再问他什么。
verses.en: When Jesus saw that he had answered wisely, he said to him, 'You are not far from the kingdom of God.' And from then on no one dared ask him any more questions.

verses.zh: 耶稣在殿里教训人，就问他们说：'文士怎么说基督是大卫的子孙呢？
verses.en: While Jesus was teaching in the temple courts, he asked, 'Why do the teachers of the law say that the Messiah is the son of David?

verses.zh: 大卫被圣灵感动，说：主对我主说：你坐在我的右边，等我使你仇敌作你的脚凳。
verses.en: David himself, speaking by the Holy Spirit, declared: The Lord said to my Lord: Sit at my right hand until I put your enemies under your feet.

verses.zh: 大卫既然称他为主，他怎么又是大卫的子孙呢？'众人都喜欢听他。
verses.en: David himself calls him Lord. How then can he be his son?' The large crowd listened to him with delight.

verses.zh: 耶稣在教训中说：'你们要防备文士。他们好穿长衣游行，喜爱人在街市上问他们的安，
verses.en: As he taught, Jesus said, 'Watch out for the teachers of the law. They like to walk around in flowing robes and be greeted with respect in the marketplaces,

verses.zh: 又喜爱会堂里的首位，筶席上的首位。
verses.en: and have the most important seats in the synagogues and the places of honor at banquets.

verses.zh: 他们侵吐寡妇的家产，假意做很长的祷告。这些人要受更重的刑罚！'
verses.en: They devour widows' houses and for a show make lengthy prayers. These men will be punished most severely.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对银库坐着，看众人怎样投钱入库。有好些财主往里投了若干的钱。
verses.en: Jesus sat down opposite the place where the offerings were put and watched the crowd putting their money into the temple treasury. Many rich people threw in large amounts.

verses.zh: 有一个穷寡妇来，往里投了两个小钱，就是一个大钱。
verses.en: But a poor widow came and put in two very small copper coins, worth only a few cents.

verses.zh: 耶稣叫门徒来，说：'我实在告诉你们，这穷寡妇投入库里的，比众人所投的更多。
verses.en: Calling his disciples to him, Jesus said, 'Truly I tell you, this poor widow has put more into the treasury than all the others.

verses.zh: 因为，他们都是自己有余，拿出来投在里头；但这寡妇是自己不足，把她一切养生的都投上了。'
verses.en: They all gave out of their wealth; but she, out of her poverty, put in everything—all she had to live on.'

verses.zh: 耶稣从殿里出来的时候，有一个门徒对他说：'夫子，请看，这是何等的石头！何等的殿宇！'
verses.en: As Jesus was leaving the temple, one of his disciples said to him, 'Look, Teacher! What massive stones! What magnificent buildings!'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'你看见这大殿宇吗？将来在这里没有一块石头留在石头上，不被拆毁了。'
verses.en: 'Do you see all these great buildings?' replied Jesus. 'Not one stone here will be left on another; every one will be thrown down.'

verses.zh: 耶稣在橄榄山上对圣殿而坐，彼得、雅各、约翰和安得烈暗暗地问他说：
verses.en: As Jesus was sitting on the Mount of Olives opposite the temple, Peter, James, John and Andrew asked him privately,

verses.zh: '请告诉我们，什么时候有这些事呢？这一切事将成的时候有什么预兆呢？'
verses.en: 'Tell us, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign that they are all about to be fulfilled?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'你们要谨慎，免得有人迷惑你们。
verses.en: Jesus said to them: 'Watch out that no one deceives you.

verses.zh: 将来有好些人冒我的名来，说：我是基督，并且要迷惑许多人。
verses.en: Many will come in my name, claiming, I am he, and will deceive many.

verses.zh: 你们听见打仗和打仗的风声，不要惊慌。这些事是必须有的，只是末期还没有到。
verses.en: When you hear of wars and rumors of wars, do not be alarmed. Such things must happen, but the end is still to come.

verses.zh: 民要攻打民，国要攻打国；多处必有地震、饥荒。这都是灾雾（灾雾：原文作生产之难）的起头。
verses.en: Nation will rise against nation, and kingdom against kingdom. There will be earthquakes in various places, and famines. These are the beginning of birth pains.

verses.zh: 但你们要谨慎；因为人要把你们交给公会，并且你们在会堂里要受鞭打，又为我的缘故站在诸侯与君王面前，对他们作见证。
verses.en: You must be on your guard. You will be handed over to the local councils and flogged in the synagogues. On account of me you will stand before governors and kings as witnesses to them.

verses.zh: 然而，福音必须先传给万民。
verses.en: And the gospel must first be preached to all nations.

verses.zh: 人把你们拉去交官的时候，不要预先思虑说什么；到那时候，赐给你们什么话，你们就说什么；因为说话的不是你们，乃是圣灵。
verses.en: Whenever you are arrested and brought to trial, do not worry beforehand about what to say. Just say whatever is given you at the time, for it is not you speaking, but the Holy Spirit.

verses.zh: 弟兄要把弟兄，父亲要把儿子，送到死地；儿女要起来与父母为敌，害死他们。
verses.en: Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death.

verses.zh: 并且你们要为我的名被众人恨恶；惟有忍耐到底的，必然得救。'
verses.en: Everyone will hate you because of me, but the one who stands firm to the end will be saved.

verses.zh: '你们看见那行毁坏可憎的，站在不当站的地方（读者须会意）。那时，在猶太的，应当逃到山上；
verses.en: When you see 'the abomination that causes desolation' standing where it does not belong—let the reader understand—then let those who are in Judea flee to the mountains.

verses.zh: 在房上的，不要下来，也不要进去拿家里的东西；
verses.en: Let no one on the housetop go down or enter the house to take anything out.

verses.zh: 在田里的，也不要回去取衣裳。
verses.en: Let no one in the field go back to get their cloak.

verses.zh: 当那些日子，怀孕的和奶孩子的有祸了！
verses.en: How dreadful it will be in those days for pregnant women and nursing mothers!

verses.zh: 你们应当祷告，叫这些事不在冬天临到。
verses.en: Pray that this will not take place in winter,

verses.zh: 因为在那些日子必有灾雾，自从神创造万物直到如今，并没有这样的灾雾，后来也必没有。
verses.en: because those will be days of distress unequaled from the beginning, when God created the world, until now—and never to be equaled again.

verses.zh: 若不是主减少那日子，凡有血气的总没有一个得救的；只是为主的选民，他将那日子减少了。
verses.en: If the Lord had not cut short those days, no one would survive. But for the sake of the elect, whom he has chosen, he has shortened them.

verses.zh: 那时若有人对你们说：看哪！基督在这里，或说：基督在那里，你们不要信！
verses.en: At that time if anyone says to you, Look, here is the Messiah! or, Look, there he is! do not believe it.

verses.zh: 因为假基督、假先知将要起来，显神迹奇事，倘若能行，就把选民迷惑了。
verses.en: For false messiahs and false prophets will appear and perform signs and wonders to deceive, if possible, even the elect.

verses.zh: 你们要谨慎。看哪，凡事我都预先告诉你们了。'
verses.en: So be on your guard; I have told you everything ahead of time.

verses.zh: '在那些日子，那灾雾以后，日头要变黑了，月亮也不放光，
verses.en: But in those days, following that distress, the sun will be darkened, and the moon will not give its light;

verses.zh: 众星要从天上坠落，天势都要震动。
verses.en: the stars will fall from the sky, and the heavenly bodies will be shaken.

verses.zh: 那时，他们（马太二十四30作“地上的万族”）要看见人子有大能力、大荣耀，驾云降临。
verses.en: At that time people will see the Son of Man coming in clouds with great power and glory.

verses.zh: 他要差遣天使，把他的选民，从四方（四方：原文作四风），从地极直到天边，都招聚了来。'
verses.en: And he will send his angels and gather his elect from the four winds, from the ends of the earth to the ends of the heavens.

verses.zh: '你们可以从无花果树学个比方：当树枝发嫩长叶的时候，你们就知道夏天近了。
verses.en: Now learn this lesson from the fig tree: As soon as its twigs get tender and its leaves come out, you know that summer is near.

verses.zh: 这样，你们几时看见这些事成就，也该知道人子（人子：或作神的国）近了，正在门口了。
verses.en: Even so, when you see these things happening, you know that it is near, right at the door.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，这世代还没有过去，这些事都要成就。
verses.en: Truly I tell you, this generation will certainly not pass away until all these things have happened.

verses.zh: 天地要废去，我的话却不能废去。
verses.en: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will never pass away.

verses.zh: '但那日子，那时辰，没有人知道，连天上的使者也不知道，子也不知道，惟有父知道。
verses.en: But about that day or hour no one knows, not even the angels in heaven, nor the Son, but only the Father.

verses.zh: 你们要谨慎，警醒祷告，因为你们不知道那日期几时来到。
verses.en: Be on guard! Be alert! You do not know when that time will come.

verses.zh: 这事正如一个人离开本家，寄居外邦，把权柄交给仆人，分派各人当做的工，又嚉咐看门的警醒。
verses.en: It's like a man going away: He leaves his house and puts his servants in charge, each with their assigned task, and tells the one at the door to keep watch.

verses.zh: 所以，你们要警醒，因为你们不知道家主什么时候来，或晚上，或半夜，或鸡叫，或早晨；
verses.en: Therefore keep watch because you do not know when the owner of the house will come back—whether in the evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or at dawn.

verses.zh: 恐怕他忽然来到，看见你们睡着了。
verses.en: If he comes suddenly, do not let him find you sleeping.

verses.zh: 我对你们所说的话，也是对众人说：要警醒！'
verses.en: What I say to you, I say to everyone: Watch!'

verses.zh: 过两天是逗越节和除酵节，祭司长和文士想法子怎么用诡计捕拿耶稣，杀他。
verses.en: Now the Passover and the Festival of Unleavened Bread were only two days away, and the chief priests and the teachers of the law were scheming to arrest Jesus secretly and kill him.

verses.zh: 只是说：'当节的日子不可，恐怕民间生乱。'
verses.en: 'But not during the festival,' they said, 'or the people may riot.'

verses.zh: 耶稣在伯大尼长大麻风的西门家里坐席的时候，有一个女人拿着一玉瓶至贵的真哪咕香膏来，打破玉瓶，把香膏浇在耶稣的头上。
verses.en: While he was in Bethany, reclining at the table in the home of Simon the Leper, a woman came with an alabaster jar of very expensive perfume, made of pure nard. She broke the jar and poured the perfume on his head.

verses.zh: 有几个人心中很不喜悦，说：'何用这样枷费香膏呢？
verses.en: Some of those present were saying indignantly to one another, 'Why this waste of perfume?

verses.zh: 这香膏可以卖三十多两银子周济穷人。'他们就向那女人生气。
verses.en: It could have been sold for more than a year's wages and the money given to the poor.' And they rebuked her harshly.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'由她吧！为什么难为她呢？她在我身上做的是一件美事。
verses.en: 'Leave her alone,' said Jesus. 'Why are you bothering her? She has done a beautiful thing to me.

verses.zh: 因为常有穷人和你们同在，要向他们行善随时都可以；只是你们不常有我。
verses.en: The poor you will always have with you, and you can help them any time you want. But you will not always have me.

verses.zh: 她所做的，是尽她所能的；她是为我安葬的事把香膏预先浇在我身上。
verses.en: She did what she could. She poured perfume on my body beforehand to prepare for my burial.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，普天之下，无论在什么地方传这福音，也要述说这女人所做的，以为记念。'
verses.en: Truly I tell you, wherever the gospel is preached throughout the world, what she has done will also be told, in memory of her.'

verses.zh: 十二门徒之中，有一个加略人犹大，去见祭司长，要把耶稣交给他们。
verses.en: Then Judas Iscariot, one of the Twelve, went to the chief priests to betray Jesus to them.

verses.zh: 他们听见就欢喜，又应许给他银子。他就寻思如何得便把耶稣交给他们。
verses.en: They were delighted to hear this and promised to give him money. So he watched for an opportunity to hand him over.

verses.zh: 除酵节的第一天，就是宰逗越羊羔的那一天，门徒对耶稣说：'你吃逗越节的筶席要我们往哪里去预备呢？'
verses.en: On the first day of the Festival of Unleavened Bread, when it was customary to sacrifice the Passover lamb, Jesus' disciples asked him, 'Where do you want us to go and make preparations for you to eat the Passover?'

verses.zh: 耶稣就打发两个门徒，对他们说：'你们进城去，必有人拿着一瓶水迎面而来，你们就跟着他。
verses.en: So he sent two of his disciples, telling them, 'Go into the city, and a man carrying a jar of water will meet you. Follow him.

verses.zh: 他进哪家去，你们就对那家的主人说：夫子说：客房在哪里？我与门徒好在那里吃逗越节的筶席。
verses.en: Say to the owner of the house he enters, The Teacher asks: Where is my guest room, where I may eat the Passover with my disciples?

verses.zh: 他必指给你们楼上一间又大又整齐的屋子，你们就在那里为我们预备。'
verses.en: He will show you a large room upstairs, furnished and ready. Make preparations for us there.'

verses.zh: 门徒出去，进了城，所遇见的正如耶稣所说的。他们就预备了逗越节的筶席。
verses.en: The disciples left, went into the city and found things just as Jesus had told them. So they prepared the Passover.

verses.zh: 到了晚上，耶稣和十二个门徒都来了。
verses.en: When evening came, Jesus arrived with the Twelve.

verses.zh: 他们坐席正吃的时候，耶稣说：'我实在告诉你们，你们中间有一个与我同吃的人要卖我了。'
verses.en: While they were reclining at the table eating, he said, 'Truly I tell you, one of you will betray me—one who is eating with me.'

verses.zh: 他们就忧愁起来，一个一个地问他说：'是我吗？'
verses.en: It was one of the Twelve,' he replied, 'one who dips bread into the bowl with me.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'是十二个门徒中同我沾手在盘子里的那个人。
verses.en: 'It is one of the Twelve,' he replied, 'one who dips bread into the bowl with me.

verses.zh: 人子必要去世，正如经上指着他所写的；但卖人子的人有祸了！那人不生在世上倒好。'
verses.en: The Son of Man will go just as it is written about him. But woe to that man who betrays the Son of Man! It would be better for him if he had not been born.'

verses.zh: 他们吃的时候，耶稣拿起饼来，祝了福，就擘开，递给他们，说：'你们拿着吃，这是我的身体。'
verses.en: While they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it and gave it to his disciples, saying, 'Take it; this is my body.'

verses.zh: 又拿起杯来，祝谢了，递给他们；他们都喝了。
verses.en: Then he took a cup, and when he had given thanks, he gave it to them, and they all drank from it.

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'这是我立约的血，为多人流出来的。
verses.en: 'This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many,' he said to them.

verses.zh: 我实在告诉你们，我不再喝这葡萄汁，直到我在神的国里喝新的那日子。'
verses.en: Truly I tell you, I will not drink again from the fruit of the vine until that day when I drink it new in the kingdom of God.'

verses.zh: 他们唱了诗，就出来，往橄榄山去。
verses.en: When they had sung a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'你们都要跌倒了，因为经上记着说：我要击打牧人，羊就分散了。
verses.en: 'You will all fall away,' Jesus told them, 'for it is written: I will strike the shepherd, and the sheep will be scattered.

verses.zh: 但我复活以后，要在你们以先往加利利去。'
verses.en: But after I have risen, I will go ahead of you into Galilee.'

verses.zh: 彼得说：'众人虽然跌倒，我总不能。'
verses.en: Peter declared, 'Even if all fall away, I will not.'

verses.zh: 耶稣对他说：'我实在告诉你，就在今天夜里，鸡叫两遍以先，你要三次不认我。'
verses.en: 'Truly I tell you,' Jesus answered, 'today—yes, tonight—before the rooster crows twice you yourself will disown me three times.'

verses.zh: 彼得却极力地说：'我就是必须和你同死，也总不能不认你。'众门徒都是这样说。
verses.en: But Peter insisted emphatically, 'Even if I have to die with you, I will never disown you.' And all the others said the same.

verses.zh: 他们来到一个地方，名叫客西马尼。耶稣对门徒说：'你们坐在这里，等我祷告。'
verses.en: They went to a place called Gethsemane, and Jesus said to his disciples, 'Sit here while I pray.'

verses.zh: 于是带着彼得、雅各、约翰同去，就惊恐起来，极其难过，
verses.en: He took Peter, James and John along with him, and he began to be deeply distressed and troubled.

verses.zh: 对他们说：'我心里甚是忧伤，几乎要死；你们在这里等候，警醒。'
verses.en: 'My soul is overwhelmed with sorrow to the point of death,' he said to them. 'Stay here and keep watch.'

verses.zh: 他就稍往前走，俶伏在地，祷告说，倘若可行，便叫那时候过去。
verses.en: Going a little farther, he fell to the ground and prayed that if possible the hour might pass from him.

verses.zh: 他说：'阿巴，父啊！在你凡事都能；求你将这杯撤去。然而，不要从我的意思，只要从你的意思。'
verses.en: 'Abba, Father,' he said, 'everything is possible for you. Take this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.'

verses.zh: 耗稣回来，见他们睡着了，就对彼得说：'西门，你睡觉吗？不能警醒片时吗？
verses.en: Then he returned to his disciples and found them sleeping. 'Simon,' he said to Peter, 'are you asleep? Couldn't you keep watch for one hour?

verses.zh: 总要警醒祷告，免得入了迷惑；你们心灵固然愿意，肉体却软弱了。
verses.en: Watch and pray so that you will not fall into temptation. The spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak.

verses.zh: 耶稣又去祷告，说的话还是一样，
verses.en: Once more he went away and prayed the same thing.

verses.zh: 又来见他们睡着了，因为他们的眼睛甚是困倦；他们也不知道怎么回答。
verses.en: When he came back, he again found them sleeping, because their eyes were heavy. They did not know what to say to him.

verses.zh: 第三次来，就对他们说：'现在你们仍然睡觉安歇吧（（吗））！够了，时候到了。看哪，人子被卖在罪人手里了。
verses.en: Returning the third time, he said to them, 'Are you still sleeping and resting? Enough! The hour has come. Look, the Son of Man is delivered into the hands of sinners.

verses.zh: 起来！我们走吧。看哪，那卖我的人近了！'
verses.en: Rise! Let us go! Here comes my betrayer!'

verses.zh: 说话之间，忽然那十二个门徒里的犹大来了，并有许多人带着刀棒，从祭司长和文士并长老那里与他同来。
verses.en: Just as he was speaking, Judas, one of the Twelve, appeared. With him was a crowd armed with swords and clubs, sent from the chief priests, the teachers of the law, and the elders.

verses.zh: 卖耶稣的人曾给他们一个暗号，说：'我与谁亲嘴，谁就是他。你们把他拿住，牢牢靠靠地带去。'
verses.en: Now the betrayer had arranged a signal with them: 'The one I kiss is the man; arrest him and lead him away under guard.'

verses.zh: 犹大来了，随即到耶稣跟前，说：'拉比！'便与他亲嘴。
verses.en: Going at once to Jesus, Judas said, 'Rabbi!' and kissed him.

verses.zh: 他们就下手拿住他。
verses.en: The men seized Jesus and arrested him.

verses.zh: 旁边站着的人，有一个拔出刀来，将大祭司的仆人砍了一刀，削掉了他一个耳朵。
verses.en: Then one of those standing near drew his sword and struck the servant of the high priest, cutting off his ear.

verses.zh: 耶稣对他们说：'你们带着刀棒捉我，如同捉强盗吗？
verses.en: 'Am I leading a rebellion,' said Jesus, 'that you have come out with swords and clubs to capture me?

verses.zh: 我天天教训人，同你们在殿里，你们并没有拿我。但这事成就，为要应验经上的话。'
verses.en: Every day I was with you, teaching in the temple courts, and you did not arrest me. But the Scriptures must be fulfilled.'

verses.zh: 门徒都离开他，逃跑了。
verses.en: Then everyone deserted him and fled.

verses.zh: 有一个少年人，赤身披着一块麻布，跟随耶稣，众人就捉拿他。
verses.en: A young man, wearing nothing but a linen garment, was following Jesus. When they seized him,

verses.zh: 他却丢了麻布，赤身逃跑了。
verses.en: he fled naked, leaving his garment behind.

verses.zh: 他们把耶稣带到大祭司那里，又有众祭司长和长老并文士都来和大祭司一同聚集。
verses.en: They took Jesus to the high priest, and all the chief priests, the elders and the teachers of the law came together.

verses.zh: 彼得远远地跟着耶稣，直到大祭司的院里，和差役一同坐在火光里烤火。
verses.en: Peter followed him at a distance, right into the courtyard of the high priest. There he sat with the guards and warmed himself at the fire.

verses.zh: 祭司长和全公会寻找见证控告耶稣，要治死他，却寻不着。
verses.en: The chief priests and the whole Sanhedrin were looking for evidence against Jesus so that they could put him to death, but they did not find any.

verses.zh: 因为有好些人作假见证告他，只是他们的见证各不相合。
verses.en: Many testified falsely against him, but their statements did not agree.

verses.zh: 又有几个人站起来作假见证告他，说：
verses.en: Then some stood up and gave this false testimony against him:

verses.zh: '我们听见他说：我要拆毁这人手所造的殿，三日内就另造一座不是人手所造的。'
verses.en: 'We heard him say, I will destroy this temple made with human hands and in three days will build another, not made with hands.'

verses.zh: 他们就是这样作见证，也是各不相合。
verses.en: Yet even then their testimony did not agree.

verses.zh: 大祭司起来站在中间，问耶稣说：'你什么都不回答吗？这些人作见证告你的是什么呢？'
verses.en: Then the high priest stood up before them and asked Jesus, 'Are you not going to answer? What is this testimony that these men are bringing against you?'

verses.zh: 耶稣却不言语，一句也不回答。大祭司又问他说：'你是那当称颂的基督，神的儿子不是？'
verses.en: But Jesus remained silent and gave no answer. Again the high priest asked him, 'Are you the Messiah, the Son of the Blessed One?'

verses.zh: 耶稣说：'我是。你们必看见人子坐在那权能者的右边，驾着天上的云降临。'
verses.en: 'I am,' said Jesus. 'And you will see the Son of Man sitting at the right hand of the Mighty One and coming on the clouds of heaven.'

verses.zh: 大祭司就撒开衣服，说：'我们何必再用见证人呢？
verses.en: The high priest tore his clothes. 'Why do we need any more witnesses?' he asked.

verses.zh: 你们已经听见他这僭妄的话了。你们的意思如何？'他们都定他的罪，说他是该死的。
verses.en: You have heard the blasphemy. What do you think?' They all condemned him as worthy of death.

verses.zh: 就有人吐唾沫在他脸上，又蒙住他的脸，用拳头打他，对他说：'你说预言吧！'差役接过他来，用手掌打他。
verses.en: Then some began to spit at him; they blindfolded him, struck him with their fists, and said, 'Prophesy!' And the guards took him and beat him.

verses.zh: 彼得在下边院子里；来了大祭司的一个使女，
verses.en: While Peter was below in the courtyard, one of the servant girls of the high priest came by.

verses.zh: 见彼得烤火，就看着他，说：'你素来也是同那拿撒勒人耶稣一伙的。'
verses.en: When she saw Peter warming himself, she looked closely at him. 'You also were with that Nazarene, Jesus,' she said.

verses.zh: 彼得却不认，说：'我不知道，也不明白你说的是什么。'于是出来，到了前院，鸡就叫了。
verses.en: But he denied it. 'I don't know or understand what you're talking about,' he said, and went out into the entryway.

verses.zh: 那使女看见他，又对旁边站着的人说：'这也是他们一党的。'
verses.en: When the servant girl saw him there, she said again to those standing around, 'This fellow is one of them.'

verses.zh: 彼得又不认。过了不多时，旁边站着的人又对彼得说：'你真是他们一党的！因为你是加利利人。'
verses.en: Again he denied it. After a little while, those standing near said to Peter, 'Surely you are one of them, for you are a Galilean.'

verses.zh: 彼得就发咒起誓说：'我不认得你们所说的这个人。'
verses.en: He began to call down curses, and he swore to them, 'I don't know this man you're talking about.'

verses.zh: 立时鸡叫第二遍。彼得想起耶稣对他所说的话：'鸡叫两遍以先，你要三次不认我。'思想起来，就哭了。
verses.en: Immediately the rooster crowed the second time. Then Peter remembered the word Jesus had spoken to him: 'Before the rooster crows twice you will disown me three times.' And he broke down and wept.

verses.zh: 一到早晨，祭司长和长老、文士和全公会一同商议，就把耶稣捆绑，解去交给彼拉多。
verses.en: Very early in the morning, the chief priests, with the elders, the teachers of the law and the whole Sanhedrin, made their plans. So they bound Jesus, led him away and handed him over to Pilate.

verses.zh: 彼拉多问他说：'你是犊太人的王吗？'耶稣回答说：'你说的是。'
verses.en: 'Are you the king of the Jews?' asked Pilate. 'You have said so,' Jesus replied.

verses.zh: 祭司长告他许多的事。
verses.en: The chief priests accused him of many things.

verses.zh: 彼拉多又问他说：'你看，他们告你这么多的事，你什么都不回答吗？'
verses.en: So again Pilate asked him, 'Aren't you going to answer? See how many things they are accusing you of.'

verses.zh: 耶稣仍不回答，以致彼拉多觉得奇怪。
verses.en: But Jesus still made no reply, and Pilate was amazed.

verses.zh: 每逢这节期，巡抚照众人所求的，释放一个囚犯给他们。
verses.en: Now it was the custom at the festival to release a prisoner whom the people requested.

verses.zh: 有一个人名叫巴拉巴，和作乱的人一同捆绑。他们作乱的时候，曾杀过人。
verses.en: A man called Barabbas was in prison with the insurrectionists who had committed murder in the uprising.

verses.zh: 众人上去求巡抚照常例给他们办。
verses.en: The crowd came up and asked Pilate to do for them what he usually did.

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：'你们要我释放犊太人的王给你们吗？'
verses.en: 'Do you want me to release to you the king of the Jews?' asked Pilate,

verses.zh: 他原晓得祭司长是因为嫉妒才把耶稣解了来。
verses.en: knowing it was out of self-interest that the chief priests had handed Jesus over to him.

verses.zh: 只是祭司长挑唆众人，宁可释放巴拉巴给他们。
verses.en: But the chief priests stirred up the crowd to have Pilate release Barabbas instead.

verses.zh: 彼拉多又说：'那么样，你们所称为犊太人的王，我怎么办他呢？'
verses.en: 'What shall I do, then, with the one you call the king of the Jews?' Pilate asked them.

verses.zh: 他们又喇道：'把他钉十字架！'
verses.en: 'Crucify him!' they shouted.

verses.zh: 彼拉多说：'为什么呢？他做了什么恶事呢？'他们便极力地喇道：'把他钉十字架！'
verses.en: 'Why? What crime has he committed?' asked Pilate. But they shouted all the louder, 'Crucify him!'

verses.zh: 彼拉多要叫众人喜悦，就释放了巴拉巴给他们，将耶稣鞭了，交给人钉十字架。
verses.en: Wanting to satisfy the crowd, Pilate released Barabbas to them. He had Jesus flogged, and handed him over to be crucified.

verses.zh: 兵丁把耶稣带进衣院里，叫齐了全营的兵。
verses.en: The soldiers led Jesus away into the palace (that is, the Praetorium) and called together the whole company of soldiers.

verses.zh: 他们给他穿上紫袍，又用荆棘编做冠冘给他戴上，
verses.en: They put a purple robe on him, then twisted together a crown of thorns and set it on him.

verses.zh: 就庆贺他说：'恐犊太人的王！'
verses.en: And they began to call out to him, 'Hail, king of the Jews!'

verses.zh: 又用芦苇打他的头，吐唒沈在他身上，屈膝拜他。
verses.en: Again and again they struck him on the head with a staff and spit on him. Falling on their knees, they paid homage to him.

verses.zh: 戏弄完了，就给他脱了紫袍，仍穿上他自己的衣服，带他出去，要钉十字架。
verses.en: And when they had mocked him, they took off the purple robe and put his own clothes on him. Then they led him out to crucify him.

verses.zh: 有一个古利奈人西门，就是亚力山大和鲁富的父亲，从乡下来，经过那地方，他们就勉强他背着耶稣的十字架。
verses.en: A certain man from Cyrene, Simon, the father of Alexander and Rufus, was passing by on his way in from the country, and they forced him to carry the cross.

verses.zh: 他们带耶稣到了各各他地方（各各他翻出来就是骷髅地），
verses.en: They brought Jesus to the place called Golgotha (which means 'the place of the skull').

verses.zh: 拿没药调和的酒给耶稣，他却不受。
verses.en: Then they offered him wine mixed with myrrh, but he did not take it.

verses.zh: 于是将他钉在十字架上，拈签分他的衣服，看是谁得什么。
verses.en: And they crucified him. Dividing up his clothes, they cast lots to see what each would get.

verses.zh: 钉他在十字架上是巳初的时候。
verses.en: It was nine in the morning when they crucified him.

verses.zh: 在上面有他的罪状，写的是：'犊太人的王。'
verses.en: The written notice of the charge against him read: the king of the jews.

verses.zh: 他们又把两个强盗和他同钉十字架，一个在右边，一个在左边。
verses.en: They crucified two rebels with him, one on his right and one on his left.

verses.zh: (这就应了经上的话说：'他被列在罪犯之中。')
verses.en: And the scripture was fulfilled that says, 'He was numbered with the transgressors.'

verses.zh: 从那里经过的人轱骂他，摇着头说：'咐！你这拆毁圣殿、三日又建造起来的，
verses.en: Those who passed by hurled insults at him, shaking their heads and saying, 'So! You who are going to destroy the temple and build it in three days,

verses.zh: 可以救自己，从十字架上下来吧！'
verses.en: come down from the cross and save yourself!'

verses.zh: 祭司长和文士也是这样戏弄他，彼此说：'他救了别人，不能救自己。
verses.en: In the same way the chief priests and the teachers of the law mocked him among themselves. 'He saved others,' they said, 'but he can't save himself!

verses.zh: 以色列的王基督，现在可以从十字架上下来，叫我们看见，就信了。'那和他同钉的人也是轱骂他。
verses.en: Let this Messiah, this king of Israel, come down now from the cross, that we may see and believe.' Those crucified with him also heaped insults on him.

verses.zh: 从午正到申初，遍地都黑暗了。
verses.en: At noon, darkness came over the whole land until three in the afternoon.

verses.zh: 申初的时候，耶稣大声喇道：'以罗伊！以罗伊！拉马撒巴各大尼？'（翻出来就是：我的神！我的神！为什么离弃我？）
verses.en: And at three in the afternoon Jesus cried out in a loud voice, 'Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?' (which means 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?').

verses.zh: 旁边站着的人，有的听见就说：'看哪，他叫以利亚呢！'
verses.en: When some of those standing near heard this, they said, 'Listen, he's calling Elijah.'

verses.zh: 有一个人跑去，把海绒蜘满了醋，绑在芦苇上，送给他喝，说：'等着，看以利亚来不来把他取下。'
verses.en: Someone ran, filled a sponge with wine vinegar, put it on a staff, and offered it to Jesus to drink. 'Now leave him alone. Let's see if Elijah comes to take him down,' he said.

verses.zh: 耶稣大声喇道，气就断了。
verses.en: With a loud cry, Jesus breathed his last.

verses.zh: 殿里的幔子从上到下裂为两半。
verses.en: The curtain of the temple was torn in two from top to bottom.

verses.zh: 对面站着的百夫长看见耶稣这样断气，就说：这人真是神的儿子！
verses.en: And when the centurion, who stood there in front of Jesus, saw how he died, he said, Surely this man was the Son of God!

verses.zh: 还有些妇女远远地观看；内中有抹大拉的马利亚，又有小雅各和约西的母亲马利亚，并有撒罗米，
verses.en: Some women were watching from a distance. Among them were Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James the younger and of Joseph, and Salome.

verses.zh: 就是耶稣在加利利的时候，跟随他、服事他的那些人，还有同耶稣上耶路撒冷来的许多妇女在那里观看。
verses.en: In Galilee these women had followed him and cared for his needs. Many other women who had come up with him to Jerusalem were also there.

verses.zh: 到了晚上，因为这是预备日，就是安息日的前一日，
verses.en: It was Preparation Day (that is, the day before the Sabbath). So as evening approached,

verses.zh: 有亚利马太人约瑟来到；他是尊贵的议士，也是等候神国的。他放胆进去见彼拉多，求耶稣的身体；
verses.en: Joseph of Arimathea, a prominent member of the Council, who was himself waiting for the kingdom of God, went boldly to Pilate and asked for Jesus' body.

verses.zh: 彼拉多诧异耶稣已经死了，便叫百夫长来，问他耶稣死了久不久。
verses.en: Pilate was surprised to hear that he was already dead. Summoning the centurion, he asked him if Jesus had already died.

verses.zh: 百夫长既然证实了，彼拉多就把耶稣的尸首赐给了约瑟。
verses.en: When he learned from the centurion that it was so, he gave the body to Joseph.

verses.zh: 约瑟买了细麻布，把耶稣取下来，用细麻布裹好，安放在磐石中凿出来的坟墓里，又滚过一块石头来挡住墓门。
verses.en: So Joseph bought some linen cloth, took down the body, wrapped it in the linen, and placed it in a tomb cut out of rock. Then he rolled a stone against the entrance of the tomb.

verses.zh: 抹大拉的马利亚和约西的母亲马利亚都看见安放他的地方。
verses.en: Mary Magdalene and Mary the mother of Joseph saw where he was laid.

verses.zh: 过了安息日，抹大拉的马利亚和雅各的母亲马利亚并撒罗米，买了香料要去膏耶稣的身体。
verses.en: When the Sabbath was over, Mary Magdalene, Mary the mother of James, and Salome bought spices so that they might go to anoint Jesus' body.

verses.zh: 七日的第一日清早，出太阳的时候，她们来到坟墓那里，
verses.en: Very early on the first day of the week, just after sunrise, they were on their way to the tomb

verses.zh: 彼此说：'谁给我们把石头从墓门滚开呢？'
verses.en: and they asked each other, 'Who will roll the stone away from the entrance of the tomb?'

verses.zh: 那石头原来甚大，她们抬头一看，却见石头已经滚开了。
verses.en: But when they looked up, they saw that the stone, which was very large, had been rolled away.

verses.zh: 她们进了坟墓，看见一个少年人坐在右边，穿着白袍，就甚惊恐。
verses.en: As they entered the tomb, they saw a young man dressed in a white robe sitting on the right side, and they were alarmed.

verses.zh: 那少年人对她们说：'不要惊恐！你们寻找那钉十字架的拿撒勒人耶稣，他已经复活了，不在这里。请看安放他的地方。
verses.en: 'Don't be alarmed,' he said. 'You are looking for Jesus the Nazarene, who was crucified. He has risen! He is not here. See the place where they laid him.

verses.zh: 你们可以去告诉他的门徒和彼得，说：他在你们以先往加利利去。在那里你们要见他，正如他从前所告诉你们的。'
verses.en: But go, tell his disciples and Peter, He is going ahead of you into Galilee. There you will see him, just as he told you.'

verses.zh: 她们就出来，从坟墓那里逃跑，又发抖又惊奇，什么也不告诉人，因为她们害怕。
verses.en: Trembling and bewildered, the women went out and fled from the tomb. They said nothing to anyone, because they were afraid.

verses.zh: 在七日的第一日清早，耶稣复活了，就先向抹大拉的马利亚显现（耶稣从她身上曾赶出七个鬼）。
verses.en: When Jesus rose early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, out of whom he had driven seven demons.

verses.zh: 她去告诉那向来跟随耶稣的人；那时他们正哀恄哭泣。
verses.en: She went and told those who had been with him and who were mourning and weeping.

verses.zh: 他们听见耶稣活了，被马利亚看见，却是不信。
verses.en: When they heard that Jesus was alive and that she had seen him, they did not believe it.

verses.zh: 这事以后，门徒中间有两个人往乡下去。走路的时候，耶稣变了形像，向他们显现。
verses.en: Afterward Jesus appeared in a different form to two of them while they were walking in the country.

verses.zh: 他们就去告诉其余的门徒；他们也是不信。
verses.en: These returned and reported it to the rest; but they did not believe them either.

verses.zh: 后来，十一个门徒坐席的时候，耶稣向他们显现，责备他们不信，心里刚硬，因为他们不信那些在他复活以后看见他的人。
verses.en: Later Jesus appeared to the Eleven as they were eating; he rebuked them for their lack of faith and their stubborn refusal to believe those who had seen him after he had risen.

verses.zh: 他又对他们说：你们往普天下去，传福音给万民听。
verses.en: He said to them, Go into all the world and preach the gospel to all creation.

verses.zh: 信而受洗的必然得救，不信的必被定罪。
verses.en: Whoever believes and is baptized will be saved, but whoever does not believe will be condemned.

verses.zh: 信的人必有神迹随着他们，就是：奉我的名赶鬼；说新方言；
verses.en: And these signs will accompany those who believe: In my name they will drive out demons; they will speak in new tongues;

verses.zh: 手能拿蛇；若喝了什么毒物，也必不受害；手按病人，病人就必好了。
verses.en: they will pick up snakes with their hands; and when they drink deadly poison, it will not hurt them at all; they will place their hands on sick people, and they will get well.

verses.zh: 主耶稣和他们说完了话，后来被接到天上，坐在神的右边。
verses.en: After the Lord Jesus had spoken to them, he was taken up into heaven and he sat at the right hand of God.

verses.zh: 门徒出去，到处宣传福音。主和他们同工，用神迹随着，证实所传的道。阿们！
verses.en: Then the disciples went out and preached everywhere, and the Lord worked with them and confirmed his word by the signs that accompanied it.
